description: Exxon Mobil reported its fourth consecutive quarterly loss on Tuesday as the pandemic continued to weigh on energy demand and oil and natural gas prices.

title: Britain, ravaged by one virus variant, is trying to hunt down another.
description: LONDON  Britain, painfully aware of the dangers posed by mutations of the coronavirus after a variant fueled a surge in deaths this winter, has sounded a full-scale alarm over the detection of another variant, this one first registered in South Africa.

title: Tesla Will Recall 135,000 Cars for Faulty Touch Screens.
description: Tesla has agreed to recall nearly 135,000 vehicles after a federal regulator raised concerns about problems with the touch-screen displays in some of the companys most expensive cars.

title: For Britains Art Dealers, Post-Brexit Trade Isnt So Free
description: LONDON  You could just jump in a van, drive to Europe and cross all the borders to buy decorative antiques. Youd drive straight back through French customs. It was seamless, said Andrew Hirst, a British dealer specializing in old textiles, who in 2018 moved with his family to Ireland, after Britains vote to leave the European Union.

title: The storm was among the biggest in New York Citys recent history.
description: Last winter was tough for New Yorkers who like to build snowmen or, inexplicably, do not mind stumbling through snow to the subway or digging out their cars.

title: 5 Classical Albums to Hear Right Now
description: The indie-rock duo Buke and Gase has long found champions in the contemporary classical world, at least as far back as the 2010 iteration of the annual marathon organized by the new-music collective Bang On a Can. In recent years, the duos lead singer, Arone Dyer, has also started writing for other performers, like Bec Plexus. On this new collaborative set with So Percussion, Buke and Gases rhythmically surprising, grungy work occasionally takes on a newly warm tinge. (Most of the albums tracks were composed collaboratively by members of both groups.)

title: Priyanka Chopra Jonass Week: Fireside Chats and Bridgerton Episodes
description: Priyanka Chopra Jonas isnt the kind to let a minute of her life slip away, even when life is on lockdown.

title: Becoming Teammates in Life and Business
description: Because marriage is an ever-evolving experience, we constantly shift, change and, in some cases, start over. In Its No Secret, couples share thoughts about commitment and tell us what they have learned, revealing their secret to making it work. (Answers are edited for context and space.)

title: More automakers drop their support of Trump-era fuel economy standards.
description: WASHINGTON  Toyota, Fiat Chrysler and several other major automakers said Tuesday that they have dropped their support for a Trump-era lawsuit that sought to block California from setting its own strict fuel-economy standards, signaling that the auto industry is ready to work with President Biden to reduce climate-warming emissions.

title: 2 F.B.I. Agents Killed in Shooting in Florida
description: MIAMI  The sun had not come up yet on Tuesday when a group of F.B.I. agents assigned to investigate criminals who prey on children online approached the Water Terrace apartments in Sunrise, Fla., to execute a search warrant, a routine part of the job that is always fraught with risk.

title: Trump had his greatest loss of support in 2020 with white voters, particularly white men.
description: Former President Donald J. Trump lost ground with every age group in the 2020 election compared to his performance in 2016, but he had his greatest erosion with white voters, particularly white men,  according to an analysis by one of his campaign pollsters.

title: Five Children and One Man Are Killed in Oklahoma Shooting
description: Five children and a man were killed and a woman was seriously injured when they were shot at a home in Muskogee, Okla., early Tuesday, the police said.

title: Kehinde Wileys Black Rock Resident Artists Are Named
description: A Congolese painter whose art reflects how globalization and consumerism have transformed African society. A Nigerian-American filmmaker whose work focuses on cultures and experiences of Africans and the diaspora. A visual activist from Texas who forces her viewers to confront issues that are deemed difficult to tackle.

title: Jazz at Lincoln Center Focuses on Musics Role in Social Justice
description: With in-person concerts unlikely to return this spring, Jazz at Lincoln Center on Tuesday announced a full season of video presentations, all centered on jazzs role in the fight for social justice.

title: The Crossword Stumper
description: Henry B. STEAGALL was a U.S. representative from Alabama from 1915 until his death in 1943. He was the chairman of the Committee of Banking and Currency, and a co-sponsor of the Banking Act of 1933, also known as the Glass-STEAGALL Act.

title: Tom Moore, 100, Dies; Inspired Covid-Ravaged U.K. With Charity Walks
description: LONDON  Tom Moore, the redoubtable 100-year-old Army veteran whose charity walks in the past year raised tens of millions of dollars for British hospitals and made him a national symbol of pluck in a country ravaged by the coronavirus pandemic, died on Tuesday.

title: As Moderna looks to increase the doses in vaccine vials, the White House announces an expected boost in manufacturing.
description: The upstart drugmaker Moderna is asking U.S. regulators to allow it to increase the amount of coronavirus vaccine put into each vial by as much as 50 percent, arguing that it can speed vaccines to patients by clearing away a simple manufacturing bottleneck: Getting medicine into bottles.

title: N.Y.C.s Covid Metrics Are Dire. Cuomo Is Reopening Restaurants Anyway.
description: Average per-capita case counts in New York City are 64 percent higher than they were in December, when Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo banned indoor dining.

title: Americas First Moonshine, Applejack, Returns in Sleeker Style
description: MORAVIAN FALLS, N.C.  On the drive up Brushy Mountain through high pine woods, the GPS guidance peters out quickly.

title: Andrew Yang Says He Has Tested Positive for the Coronavirus
description: Andrew Yang, a leading New York mayoral candidate who has pursued extensive in-person campaigning amid the pandemic, announced on Tuesday that he had tested positive for the coronavirus.

title: Uber buys Drizly, an alcohol delivery service, for $1.1 billion.
description: Uber has acquired Drizly, the alcohol delivery service, in a $1.1 billion deal, the ride-hailing company said on Tuesday. The acquisition is part of Ubers aggressive push to expand its booming delivery business during the pandemic.

title: Is Seeing That Renoir Essential? In the Pandemic, Cities Differ
description: CHICAGO  On a recent afternoon outside the Art Institute of Chicago, there was no trace of the line that typically snakes down the museums granite steps and along Michigan Avenue as visitors wait to enter the grand home of Edward Hoppers Nighthawks and Grant Woods American Gothic. Every so often a passer-by paused on the desolate sidewalk to take a selfie with one of the bronze lions guarding the museum, but there was no reason to go further: The doors were locked.

title: U.S. Cities Are Vastly Undercounting Emissions, Researchers Find
description: When cities try to figure out the amount of greenhouse gases they emit, they tend to undercount  and not just by a little.

title: Watch Live: White House Provides Updates on Coronavirus Response
description: Jeffrey Zients, the White Houses coronavirus response coordinator, holds a briefing on the governments progress.

title: Marezzata, Serving Italian Food With Wagyu Beef, Opens in Midtown East
description: Italian food prepared with a Japanese pantry  or vice versa  is not new. Kimika in NoLIta opened last summer and fit the mold. Now, theres a restaurant in Midtown Manhattan, from the group that includes Tomoe Food Services, a meat distributor specializing in Wagyu, where the emphasis is on Italian fare with Wagyu beef as an essential component in a few dishes. The same owners have the more Wagyu-centric restaurant J-Spec in the East Village. Wagyu, both imported and domestic, is having its moment of late, showing up more than ever on New York menus. But at this new place, there are choices like eggplant dengaku fritters, spaghetti giapponese with soy-butter sauce, and fried calamari with shiso chimichurri sauce, that fuse Japanese and Italian without the Wagyu. For now, the restaurant is only for takeout and delivery. A 25 percent discount is in effect through the end of the month for a one-pound top sirloin American Wagyu steak, and penne cacciatore with three cuts of beef, peppers, potatoes, zucchini, butter and tomato sauce. Eventually there will be outdoor seating; indoors at 25 percent capacity will allow for 36 diners.

title: Biden Reinstates Aluminum Tariffs in One of His First Trade Moves
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden reinstated tariffs on aluminum exported from the United Arab Emirates on Monday evening, reversing President Donald J. Trumps decision to lift them on his last day in office.

title: Virus Surge in Portugal Puts Hospitals on the Brink
description: Portugal, struggling to contain a coronavirus outbreak that has led to the highest death rate in Europe, has rapidly filled the beds in intensive care units established for Covid-19 patients and is being forced to turn away critically ill patients from hospitals.

title: Myanmars Army Is Back in Charge. It Never Truly Left.
description: The men in army green never truly retreated.

title: Amazon agrees to $62 million settlement for withholding tips to delivery drivers.
description: Amazon agreed on Tuesday to pay $62 million to the Federal Trade Commission to settle charges that it withheld tips to delivery drivers over a two-and-a-half year period, in a case that highlights the federal governments increased interest in gig-economy workers.

title: Can a Comic Book Contain the Drama and Heat of Activism?
description: Writing this book broke my heart, David F. Walker admits in the afterword to his ambitious and informative graphic history THE BLACK PANTHER PARTY (Ten Speed, 183 pp., $19.99), crisply illustrated by Marcus Kwame Anderson. Founded in 1966 by Bobby Seale and Huey P. Newton, the Black Panther Party for Self-Defense was the most famous exponent of the Black Power movement. Its Ten Point Program (reproduced in full in these pages) was a forceful manifesto demanding land, bread, housing, education, clothing, justice and peace for the Black community. In the immediate wake of the horrific killings of Breonna Taylor, Ahmaud Arbery and George Floyd, Walker notes that every single concern the Panthers addressed  from police brutality to reparations  is still relevant.

title: Read the Brief from Trumps Defense Team on Impeachment Charge
description: Former President Donald J. Trumps legal team submitted a brief on Tuesday to the Senate outlining his defense against the impeachment charge of incitement of insurrection.

title: Slow Pace of Vaccinations Pushes Europe Toward Second Economic Slump
description: The new year was supposed to bring improved economic fortunes across Europe, as coronavirus vaccines made their way into the bloodstream.

title: Democrats push to roll back some business tax cuts in stimulus talks.
description: More than 100 Democratic lawmakers are urging Speaker Nancy Pelosi of California and Senator Chuck Schumer of New York, the majority leader, to repeal a business tax break as part of the economic aid package that Democrats hope to send to President Biden in the coming weeks.

title: How Afraid Should Corporate America Be of Joe Biden?
description: This article is copublished with ProPublica, a nonprofit newsroom that investigates abuses of power.

title: Sundance Diary, Part 5: A Final List of Movies to Revisit
description: A.O. Scott, our co-chief film critic, is keeping a diary as he attends the virtual Sundance Film Festival, which ends Wednesday. Read previous entries here and here.

title: How to Fix Facebook Groups
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: A Storm for the Record Books
description: A powerful winter storm pummeled the northeast, dropping more than a foot of snow in many areas

title: Wool, Sneakers and Community: Ballet Class Persists Outdoors
description: Once a week, Amelia Heintzelman puts on two pairs of socks, two pairs of pants and two coats, and ventures out to dance rehearsal from her home in Ridgewood, Queens. Carrying only a few items like her phone and keys, so as not to further weigh herself down, she jogs three and a half miles to the edge of the East River in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. For the next two hours, shell be dancing outdoors, and the bundled-up run generates much-needed heat.

title: Read the Brief From the Impeachment Managers
description: Nine House Democrats submitted a 80-page pretrial brief laying out their case in the impeachment trial against former President Donald J. Trump.

title: John J. Sweeney, Crusading Labor Leader, Is Dead at 86
description: John J. Sweeney, a New York union researcher who climbed to the pinnacle of the American labor movement in the 1990s, leading the A.F.L.-C.I.O. for 14 years through an era of fading union membership but rising political influence, died on Monday at his home in Bethesda, Md. He was 86.

title: White House Will Send Vaccinations Directly to Pharmacies
description: The Biden administration said on Tuesday that it would allocate a minimum of 10.5 million doses of coronavirus vaccines to states in the next three weeks, and would also send some doses directly to retail pharmacies.

title: Iran Agrees to Free South Korean Ships Crew
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Iran has agreed to free the 19-member crew of a seized South Korea-flagged ship, both countries said Tuesday, in what appeared to be the first significant gesture by the Iranians to de-escalate the problem since impounding the vessel a month ago.

title: Hal Holbrook Inspired a Biography of Mark Twain
description: To the Editor:

title: Anything for Selena Examines a Singers Legacy and Latino Identity
description: Maria Garcia has a distinct memory of when her connection to Selena Quintanilla-Prez began. It was the early 1990s and she was 7, watching the Tejano star perform on television.

title: Robinhoods C.E.O. Is in the Hot Seat
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Vlad Tenev, the chief executive of the online brokerage Robinhood, has had practice doing damage control.

title: Russias Vaccine Is Safe and Effective, Published Study Shows
description: MOSCOW  Russia cleared a hurdle in its vaccine rollout on Monday with the publication in the respected British medical journal The Lancet of late-stage trial results showing that the countrys Sputnik V vaccine is safe and highly effective.

title: Blood Meal Review: Just Us, Locked Down in a Dollhouse
description: The bugs have made Sam and Lindsay prisoners of their own home. To battle the invasion, the couple live in bare rooms, the furniture wrapped in plastic. They dont leave the house and dont welcome anybody in, either: They refuse entry to Girl Scouts selling cookies and after drinks with friends on the porch  in the middle of winter  they throw their clothes in garbage bags.

title: Biden and Drug Makers Look to Speed Coronavirus Vaccine Deliveries
description: WASHINGTON  As President Biden winds up his second week in office, a flurry of developments in vaccine production and distribution could mean a bigger boost to coronavirus vaccine supplies than was expected even just days ago.

title: Navient, a student loan company, is ordered to repay $22 million to the government.
description: In 2009, an investigation by the Education Departments inspector general concluded that Sallie Mae, a federal loan provider, overcharged the government by tens of millions of dollars for student loan subsidies. More than a decade later, the departments acting secretary has ordered the company to give the money back.

title: Politicos chief executive is stepping down this year.
description: Patrick Steel, the chief executive of Politico since 2017, said on Tuesday that he will leave the company this summer.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: A Moscow court found that President Vladimir Putins loudest critic had violated his parole. Aleksei Navalny, Russias most prominent opposition leader, was sentenced to more than two years in prison on Tuesday, a decision likely to send him to a far-flung penal colony for the first time.

title: Tiny Love Stories: He Had the Nicest Toes
description: I found myself in rural Oregon, two years into a marriage with the wrong man and on a steep learning curve. My home: a drafty hand-built cabin with an inefficient wood stove. My partner: a developing opioid addict. Life was dark and cold. Then I met my neighbors. Some my age, some 50 years older. They shared wine, stories and laughter. They taught me to identify native plants, dress a turkey, read the lay of the land, preserve a garden harvest. And to mend everything worth saving and loving  which, their kindness taught me, included myself.  Cate Keller

title: Bringing Stages to Storefronts in a Theater-Hungry City
description: MIAMI  As the final performance of Miami New Dramas Seven Deadly Sins ended Sunday night, the actors streamed onto Lincoln Road, thanking the companys artistic director, Michel Hausmann. They had spent months performing separately, inside adjacent vacant storefronts on this South Beach pedestrian mall, to an audience that watched and listened from a distance.

title: Pete Buttigieg Is Confirmed as Bidens Transportation Secretary
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate on Tuesday confirmed Pete Buttigieg, a former mayor of South Bend, Ind., and a 2020 Democratic presidential candidate, to be transportation secretary, putting in place the official who will help oversee President Bidens overhaul of the nations infrastructure.

title: Ginni Thomas apologizes to her husbands Supreme Court clerks for discord she says she caused.
description: Virginia Thomas, a conservative legal activist and the wife of Justice Clarence Thomas, has expressed regret over her role in discord among Justice Thomass former law clerks because of her support for President Donald J. Trump and the Jan. 6 rally that preceded the storming of the Capitol.

title: Hero, Inspiration and Beacon of Hope: Tributes Pour In for Tom Moore
description: LONDON  The messages of condolences have come from Queen Elizabeth, Englands national soccer team and a member of the British pop group One Direction.

title: We Cant Stop Thinking About Amanda Gormans Headband
description: Was the hair accessory that Amanda Gorman wore to the presidential inauguration a headband? Or was it a crown?

title: SpaceXs Prototype Mars Rocket Crashes in Test Flight
description: If it exploded last time, try, try again. They did, and it exploded again.

title: Some states in the U.S. are pulling back vaccine doses from the federal program for nursing homes.
description: It did not take long for Keith Reed, a deputy health commissioner in Oklahoma, to spot a big logistical problem with the states vaccination rollout. Week after week, Oklahoma was allocating thousands of precious doses to a federal program for nursing home patients that was not using them all. In fact, tens of thousands of doses were sitting untouched in freezers.

title: In Gay Bar, Time-Hopping Snapshots of Queer Nightlife
description: Our favorite adjectives are revealing. The reason we love people, the writer and interviewer Paul Holdengrber has said, is that we find that we have these favorites in common.

title: A SoulCycle Instructor Got the Vaccine as an Educator
description: For Stacey Griffith, a New York City-based SoulCycle instructor whose highly sought-after spin classes are often studded with celebrities, securing a vaccine dose was simple enough: She filled out some paperwork, and on Friday made the hour drive from Manhattan to a coronavirus vaccination site on Staten Island.

title: E.A. Sports Will Resurrect College Football Video Game
description: The Electronic Arts college football video game franchise, long beloved by sports fans but paused indefinitely years ago when it was swept up in wrangling over the rights of student-athletes, will be revived, the game maker said Tuesday.

title: Should Biden Compromise on a Relief Bill?
description: To the Editor:

title: Jeff Bezos to Step Down as Amazon C.E.O.
description: SEATTLE  When Jeff Bezos founded an online bookseller named Amazon in 1994, he said the question that he was asked most frequently was Whats the internet?

title: SpaceXs Starship Crashes Again During Prototype Launch
description: A test flight of SpaceXs Starship, Elon Musks next-generation spacecraft which is intended to one day land on Mars, was launched on Tuesday for a brief flight, but came to an explosive end.

title: After a Bruising Year, the Oil Industry Confronts a Diminished Future
description: HOUSTON  Big Oil isnt so big anymore.

title: A U.S. program aiming to channel a huge number of vaccines through pharmacies will start soon.
description: The federal government will send one million vaccine doses to about 6,500 retail pharmacies on Feb. 11, the beginning of a federal program that will deliver vaccines directly to as many as 40,000 drugstores and grocery stores, Jeffrey D. Zients, the White Houses Covid-19 response coordinator, announced on Tuesday.

title: People Died at the Capitol. Will Rioters Be Charged With Murder?
description: Since news of the first death during the Capitol riot on Jan. 6 broke  which is to say, before the riot was even over  lawmakers, television personalities and countless regular people on social media have been saying that the rioters have blood on their hands.

title: Automakers Drop Efforts to Derail California Climate Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Toyota, Fiat Chrysler and several other major automakers said Tuesday they would no longer try to block California from setting its own strict fuel-economy standards, signaling that the auto industry is ready to work with President Biden on his largest effort to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Democrats Speed Ahead on Economic Aid Package
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats are taking steps to push through President Bidens $1.9 trillion economic rescue plan, using a budgetary maneuver that could eventually allow the measure to become law without Republican support.

title: 6 Arrested After Briefly Altering Hollywood Sign
description: A Los Angeles woman and five friends carried out an elaborate stunt on Monday afternoon to transform the fabled sign overlooking Hollywood.

title: What I Saw During Myanmars Coup
description: YANGON, Myanmar  At 6 a.m. on Monday, my phone rang mercilessly. I ignored the first call, assuming that a Taiwanese friend had forgotten about the time difference. I was still struggling to sleep, and then I saw my mothers name flash on the screen. My mother, who lives in Mandalay, in the middle of Myanmar, about 400 miles from Yangon, never calls that early in the morning.

title: Silent, Rapper Behind Viral 2015 Hit, Is Charged With Murder
description: The rapper Silent, whose hit Watch Me (Whip/Nae Nae) was a viral phenomenon in 2015, has been arrested and charged in the shooting death of his cousin outside Atlanta last month, the authorities said.

title: They Want to Start Paying Mother Nature for All Her Hard Work
description: The global system is built on buying and selling, but often, no one pays for the most basic goods and services that sustain life  water to drink, soil to grow food, clean air to breathe, rain forests that regulate the climate.

title: Barry Lewis, Beloved Guide to New York City, Dies at 75
description: Barry Lewis, an erudite and wisecracking architectural historian whose lectures and walking tours of New York City neighborhoods made him a local celebrity, died on Jan. 12 in San Diego. He was 75.

description: WASHINGTON  Republicans fighting over their partys future face a turning point on Wednesday as House leaders confront dueling calls to punish two members: one for spreading conspiracy theories and endorsing political violence, and the other for voting to impeach former President Donald J. Trump.

title: Italy Looks to Mario Draghi to Solve Crisis, to Delight of Pro-E.U. Politicians
description: ROME  The high-stakes negotiations to resolve Italys political crisis in the midst of a pandemic took a remarkable turn on Tuesday evening when the countrys president summoned Mario Draghi, the former head of the European Central Bank, to begin talks to form a new government.

description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: How I Wrote the Pandemic: The Writer of Locked Down Explains
description: How do you tell the story of the coronavirus pandemic? How will the events of the past year  both catastrophic and intangible, global and intimate, diffuse but interconnected  be inevitably abridged for audiences of the future?

title: A Tale of Two Zooms: Arenado Trade Draws Mixed Emotions
description: The Colorado Rockies and the St. Louis Cardinals staged simultaneous news conferences on Tuesday, with starkly different tones.

title: Protests Rise After Officer in Tamir Rice Shooting Plays on Football Team
description: When the new player appeared on the semipro football team made up of emergency workers, he simply went by Tim or Timmy. He was noticeably bad at football, said Randy Knight, a lineman on the team, who took Tim under his wing and taught him the basics: assuming a three-point stance, firing off the line, proper hand placement at the line of scrimmage.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: The pandemic has disproportionately harmed low-income communities of color, yet people from wealthier, largely white neighborhoods are taking an outsize share of vaccines.

title: My 6-Year-Old Has the Coronavirus. Im Trying to Stay Calm.
description: I have spent the past 11 months filling my children with fear. Dont touch that, I say. Lift your mask over your nose. Keep six feet away! I have chosen not to water down the reasons, explaining to my 6- and 9-year-old sons what the coronavirus is and how it infects and how many people have died and continue to die daily in the United States (2,010 on Monday). I have been especially preachy with my youngest. Weve talked about his lungs. About the pulmonologist who told us he had tracheomalacia at 18 months and then, later, asthma. Weve talked about all the emergency medical visits, all the nebulizers and inhalers that fill our kitchen cabinet.

title: Vladimir Putin Has Become Americas Ex-Boyfriend From Hell
description: The recent discovery of a massive, highly sophisticated hack, almost certainly by Russia, of key U.S. technology companies and government agencies puts the new Biden team in a real quandary: How, when or even whether should they retaliate against Russias president? I have a lot of sympathy with that quandary  because Vladimir Putin has become Americas ex-boyfriend from hell.

title: Ricky Powell, 59, Dies; Chronicled Early Hip-Hop and Downtown New York
description: Ricky Powell, the downtown New York Zelig who with his point-and-shoot camera documented the early years of hip-hops ascendance as well as a host of other subcultural scenes and the celebrities and fringe characters who populated the city, was found dead on Feb. 1 in his West Village apartment. He was 59.

title: Eugenio Martnez, Last of the Watergate Burglars, Dies at 98
description: Eugenio Martnez, the last surviving Watergate burglar and the only figure in the scandal besides Richard M. Nixon to be granted a presidential pardon, died on Saturday in Minneola, Fla. He was 98.

title: F.B.I. Agents Killed in Florida Shooting
description: Two F.B.I. agents were killed and three more were injured as they were executing a search warrant in Sunrise, Fla., in a case that involved violent crimes against children.

title: U.N. Delays Salvage of Yemen Oil Tanker Amid Fears of Major Spill
description: The United Nations said Tuesday that it had indefinitely delayed an expedition to avert an ecological disaster from a crippled Yemeni tanker holding roughly 48 million gallons of oil, citing what the organization called a failure by Yemens Houthi insurgents to guarantee the salvage teams safety in writing.

title: Biden Signs 3 Executive Orders on Immigration
description: President Biden on Tuesday signed three executive orders aiming to roll back former President Donald J. Trumps policies on immigration and reunite migrant families who were separated at the Mexican border.

title: Mayorkas Sworn In as Secretary of Homeland Security
description: Alejandro N. Mayorkas was sworn in as homeland security secretary on Tuesday, making him the first Latino and the first immigrant to hold the position.

title: Impeachment Case Argues Trump Was Singularly Responsible for Capitol Riot
description: WASHINGTON  The House impeachment managers on Tuesday laid out their case against Donald J. Trump, asserting that he was singularly responsible for the deadly assault on the Capitol last month and must be convicted and barred from holding public office.

title: Judge Postpones Guantnamo Court Appearances, Citing Pandemic
description: WASHINGTON  A military judge on Tuesday indefinitely postponed the arraignment of three prisoners at Guantnamo Bay who were scheduled to make their first court appearance in 17 years of detention, finding that the coronavirus pandemic made it too risky to travel to the Navy base.

title: Aleksei Navalny Is Resisting Putin, and Winning
description: A Russian court on Tuesday opened a new and fateful stage in the gripping power struggle between Aleksei Navalny, Russias tough-talking and internet-savvy opposition leader, and President Vladimir Putin, by sentencing Mr. Navalny to his first serious stint in prison.

title: Hunting Rats, Defending Democracy: Hong Kongs Local Leaders Under Fire
description: HONG KONG  Some days, Cathy Yau wanders down dark alleys looking for rats to poison. Other days, she helps food banks deliver meals to older people. Often her phone rings with calls from constituents: neighbors asking about their rights during a police stop-and-frisk, or how to best navigate the citys welfare bureaucracy.

title: Questloves Summer of Soul Wins at Sundance
description: A documentary about the 1969 Harlem Cultural Festival, often called the Black Woodstock, and a feature about a hearing daughter in a deaf family took top honors Tuesday night at the first virtual edition of the Sundance Film Festival.

title: President Biden pays his respects to Brian Sicknick, the officer who died from injuries from the Capitol riot.
description: President Biden traveled to the Capitol on Tuesday evening to pay his respects to Brian D. Sicknick, the Capitol Police officer who died from injuries sustained during a Jan. 6 mob attack and whose remains were brought to lie in honor in the Capitol Rotunda.

title: Live (Together)
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  February is Black History Month, and the puzzles for Monday through Saturday this week were made by Black constructors. In this article, the editorial director for New York Times Games, Everdeen Mason, discusses the weeks puzzles in the context of Black History Month.

title: Three Skiers Found Dead After Avalanche in Colorado, Officials Say
description: Three backcountry skiers in southwestern Colorado were found dead on Wednesday, two days after the group they were traveling with triggered a large avalanche, officials said.

title: Quotation of the Day: Prison Sentence Stifles the Voice of a Putin Critic
description: There was Alexander the Liberator and Yaroslav the Wise. Now well have Vladimir the Poisoner of Underpants.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: A Moscow court sentenced Aleksei Navalny, President Vladimir Putins loudest critic, to more than two years in prison on Tuesday for violating parole from a 2014 suspended sentence by not checking in with the authorities, including while he was in Germany recovering from being poisoned in August. The decision is likely to send him to a far-flung penal colony for the first time.

title: Corrections: Feb. 3, 2021
description: An article on Thursday about vaccine shortages in the European Union misstated the percentage of the Israeli population that had received a first dose of the vaccine. More than 30 percent of the population had gotten a first dose, not more than 40 percent.

title: Bannon, Pardoned by Trump, Now Faces Manhattan D.A. Investigation
description: Stephen K. Bannon, who received a last-minute pardon from former President Donald J. Trump after being indicted on federal charges of defrauding donors to a border wall, may yet face state charges in connection with the same scheme.

title: Explosion Critically Injures 3 Near Los Angeles
description: Three people were hospitalized in critical condition with burns after an explosion near Los Angeles on Tuesday afternoon sparked a small wildfire, the authorities said.

title: Nearly 20 Million Americans Have a Felony Record. What Happens After Theyve Served Their Time?
description: There is, of course, the immediate experience of incarceration: the detention at any given moment of more than 2 million people in American jails and prisons, or what the sociologist Reuben Jonathan Miller calls cages  a word that captures the brute fact of confinement more vividly than the antiseptic vocabulary of correctional facilities.

title: Word + Quiz: ambiguous
Trumps Being Impeached Again, So It Must Be Groundhog Day
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Under-Eye Circles
description: According to a recent article in the Style section, a trend overtaking TikTok and Instagram has creators not only uncovering their under-eye bags, but accentuating them.

title: Liz Cheney Chooses Her Own Path, and Its a Perilous One
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo.  Liz Cheney was getting so many questions from constituents and colleagues about whether she would vote to affirm the 2020 election results that she responded in a way befitting her background as a State Department diplomat and lawyer: She issued a 21-page memo detailing the constitutional and legal reasons Congress should not interfere with certification.

title: This Kids Special: Candace Parker Owned L.A. From Day 1
description: Candace Parkers storied tenure with the Los Angeles Sparks is over. On Monday, she signed a two-year deal with the Chicago Sky, one of the most shocking decisions ever in W.N.B.A. free agency. Parker, who was drafted No. 1 over all by the Sparks in 2008, is headed back home, not far from where she grew up in Naperville, Ill.

title: Nearly half of U.S. states allow teachers to get shots.
description: Almost half of U.S. states have begun allowing teachers to be vaccinated as officials decide which groups should be given priority for early protection against the coronavirus, a New York Times survey shows. By this week, 24 states and Washington, D.C., were providing shots to teachers of kindergarten through high school students.

title: Lesson of the Day: Myanmars Coup, Explained
description: Featured Article: Myanmars Coup, Explained by Russell Goldman

title: Forty Hours Later, A Shot at a Vaccine
description: Broadbent Arena was known for its monster truck rallies and as the former home of Louisvilles ice hockey teams. Its large doors and ventilation made it the perfect venue for its new purpose: distributing as many coronavirus vaccines as possible, as quickly as possible.

title: How Do You Express Yourself Creatively?
description: In what ways do you express yourself creatively? Through art? Acting? Writing? Dancing? Cooking? Making music? Something else?

title: Saying Goodbye With Beans
description: After nearly three years of hemming and hawing, I finally bought an Instant Pot after two of my most trusted colleagues swore theyd never cook beans without it again. But having used it for months, I have to confess: I sort of hate what might be the most popular cooking appliance of recent years. It feels important for me to reveal this to you now, because this is my final column for The Times Magazine.

title: From Turkey to China to Norway, These Novels Take You Back in Time
description: Whatever you do, whatever you call your form of government, you end up with a sultan at the top. When LOVE IN THE DAYS OF REBELLION (Europa, 496 pp., paper, $19) was first published in Turkey in 2001, Ahmet Altan, the author who gave those words to one of his characters, was a free man and Recep Tayyip Erdogan, the former mayor of Istanbul, was just beginning his rise to national prominence. But Brendan Freely and Yelda Turedis translation of Altans novel arrives under very different circumstances, with President Erdogan firmly in power and Altan behind bars, a political prisoner accused of crimes against the state for his activities as a journalist. Reading the newly released second volume of Altans Ottoman Quartet suggests that the death of his countrys old empire may shed light on the new ones that followed.

title: The Many Lives of Steven Yeun
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Hooking Readers on Classical Music, Five Minutes at a Time
description: Mark Hamill was spellbound by a Mozart composition, but he couldnt remember its name. The haunting choral masterpiece played near the end of the Broadway production of Amadeus more than 40 years ago, in which he performed the title role.

title: I Miss a Lot of Things About the Office. My Breast Pump Isnt One.
description: I miss my colleagues. I miss listening to podcasts during my morning commute. I miss water-cooler gossip. But you know what I dont miss? My breast pump, the office lactation room, and most everything tied to being a nursing mom in the workplace.

title: They Supported Defund the Police. Then the Mayoral Campaign Began.
description: Nearly eight months ago, Scott M. Stringer stood in Brooklyn before an angry, unsettled gathering to memorialize the death of George Floyd. The best way to honor him, Mr. Stringer said, was to send a clear message to City Hall: Its time to defund the N.Y.P.D. now.

title: New York City Barely Tests for Virus Variants. Can That Change?
description: In New York City, despite its many major hospitals and research institutions, only about 55 coronavirus cases a day on average last month were sequenced and screened for more contagious variants.

title: Can Exercise Make You More Creative?
description: If you often exercise, theres a good chance you also tend to be more creative, according to an interesting new study of the links between physical activity and imagination. It finds that active people come up with more and better ideas during tests of their inventiveness than people who are relatively sedentary, and suggests that if we wish to be more innovative, we might also want to be movers and shakers.

title: Trump Loyalists Across Homeland Security Could Vex Bidens Immigration Policies
description: WASHINGTON  After a Texas judge last week temporarily blocked President Bidens order to pause deportations for 100 days, immigration agents did not hesitate to use the brief window to break with the incoming presidents new tone.

title: The Downside to Life in a Supertall Tower: Leaks, Creaks, Breaks
description: The nearly 1,400-foot tower at 432 Park Avenue, briefly the tallest residential building in the world, was the pinnacle of New Yorks luxury condo boom half a decade ago, fueled largely by foreign buyers seeking discretion and big returns.

title: Ive Never Hated Anything as Much as I Hate This
description: Listen and subscribe to The Argument from your mobile device:

title: The Hopeful Future and the Patients Who Wont See It
description: It takes nearly an hour to clean an intensive care unit room between Covid-19 patients.

title: Rebuild or Leave Paradise: Climate Change Dilemma Facing a Nicaraguan Coastal Town
description: Two major November hurricanes slammed into the same part of the Nicaraguan coast, laying waste to the Miskito village of Haulover. Faced with a future of intensifying storms, the residents must now consider whether to abandon their way of life by the ocean and move inland.

title: Burned by Low Reimbursements, Some Doctors Stop Testing for Covid
description: Dr. Robin Larabee was thrilled to start offering coronavirus testing at her pediatrics practice in Denver last fall. Testing for children is often scarce, and her new machines could return results within minutes.

title: As Jeff Bezos Takes Off, Meet His Earthbound Successor
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: After Hurricanes Devastation, a Dilemma in Nicaragua: Rebuild or Relocate?
description: HAULOVER, Nicaragua  When the leaders of an Indigenous Miskito village returned to their homes days after Hurricane Iota struck last November, they found their lush community in Nicaraguas northeast laid to ruin  and the coastline itself transformed.

title: The GOATs a Hog. Still, I Want Tom Brady to Win.
description: If youre a fan of any team in the National Football League other than the New England Patriots, you spent much of the past two decades hating the quarterback Tom Brady, by which I really mean fearing and resenting Tom Brady, because he and the Pats won so damned much that they were bound to throttle your team at some point, probably on their way to yet another Super Bowl appearance and victory. It just wasnt fair.

title: Can We Please Stop Talking About Stocks, Please?
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: A Mysterious, Lethal Chimp Disease Is Linked to a Human Illness
description: Chimpanzees had been dying mysteriously at the Tacugama sanctuary in Sierra Leone for a decade or so by 2016 when Tony Goldberg set to work on figuring out why.

title: 5 Minutes That Will Make You Love String Quartets
description: In the past, weve chosen the five minutes or so we would play to make our friends fall in love with classical music, the piano, opera, the cello, Mozart, 21st-century composers, the violin, Baroque music, sopranos, Beethoven and the flute.

title: Risking Everything to Come to America on the Open Ocean
description: The fiberglass skiff Lazora idled on the darkened Pacific Ocean a few miles south of American waters. It was roughly 25 feet long and seven feet wide, unlit, overloaded and offering no shelter from the elements. Twenty people were crammed aboard. Most were seated on narrow benches. A few huddled on the vomit-splattered deck. Some had opened slits in plastic garbage bags and pushed heads and arms through, flimsy protection against the damp October chill. Few life jackets were visible. At the boats stern, two Mexican men tended a 200-horsepower outboard engine and 10 plastic barrels of fuel. They were in the final hour of ferrying a load of undocumented migrants toward American land, in waters nearly three-quarters of a mile deep: human smugglers, running a boat through a seam where black sea met black sky.

title: Are Private Messaging Apps the Next Misinformation Hot Spot?
description: Encrypted messaging apps, which protect the privacy of online conversations, were once special tools used primarily by people working in professions where confidentiality was prized, like law, journalism and politics.

title: The QAnon Delusion Has Not Loosened Its Grip
description: A conspiracy theory promulgated by Donald Trump, the loser of the 2020 presidential election, has gripped American politics since Nov. 3. It has been willingly adopted by millions of his followers, as well as by a majority of Republican members of Congress  145 to 108  and by thousands of Republican state and local officials, all of whom have found it expedient to capitulate to the fantastical claim that the election was stolen by the Democratic Party, its officeholders, operatives and supporters.

title: Help! Im Vaccinated, but What Do I Need to Know to Protect Others?
description: Ive had my first vaccination shot and plan to book a flight to California two weeks after my second one. Like so many others, I have not seen my grandchildren for more than 15 months, during which time the baby became a toddler and the preschooler became a young boy. Now that some of us are getting successfully vaccinated and are planning on flying to see our families, I have a few questions that Im hoping you can clear up. Margot

title: Biden Administration Faces Backlog of 380,000 Waiting to Immigrate
description: When the pandemic forced her childrens school and day care to close, Luwam Beyene started working nights so she could be home during the day. As soon as she gets home, she makes breakfast and gets her son ready for online school. The children often have her attention until she leaves again for work in the evenings.

title: In the Ozarks, the Pandemic Threatens a Fragile Musical Tradition
description: McCLURG, Mo.  In an abandoned general store along a nearly deserted country road, Alvie Dooms, 90, and Gordon McCann, 89, played rhythm guitar. Nearly a dozen more musicians, many of them also older adults, joined in on fiddle, mandolin, banjo and upright bass. Their tunes had names like Last Train Home, Pig Ankle Rag and Arkansas Traveler.

title: Living In ... Madison, Conn.
description: The shoreline town, which has seen an influx of buyers during the pandemic, has been praised by new arrivals as neither too hip, nor too boring.

title: Madison, Conn.: A Welcoming Town With Long Stretches of Beach
description: About a year ago, Margaret Muir, an agent with William Pitt Sothebys International Realty in Madison, Conn., was bemoaning the states lackluster housing market and a population on the decline. More people were leaving my beautiful Connecticut than moving in, she said.

title: After the Storm, New York Digs Its Way Out
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: W.H.O. experts who are investigating the origin of the virus visit a lab in Wuhan.
description: A team of experts from the World Health Organization investigating the origins of the pandemic visited a research center in Wuhan, China, on Wednesday that has been a focus of several unfounded theories about the coronavirus.

title: The Year-Round Garden
description: Is it really possible to garden year-round?

title: In Rare Public Statement, Congressional Aides Call for Trumps Conviction
description: WASHINGTON  More than 370 Democratic congressional aides issued an unusual public appeal on Wednesday, imploring senators  in some cases their own bosses  to convict former President Donald J. Trump for inciting a violent attack on our workplace that threatened the peaceful transition of power.

title: Please, Give Me Back My Daughter
description: When her daughter Karen was kidnapped in 2014, Miriam Rodrguez knew exactly who was responsible: the Zetas, a cartel that ran organized crime in her town of San Fernando, Mexico.

title: After Coup, Myanmar Military Charges Aung San Suu Kyi With Obscure Infraction
description: Two days after Myanmars military seized power in a coup, the scope of its formal allegations against the countrys civilian leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, are taking shape: She is accused of illegally importing at least 10 walkie-talkies.

title: Some doctors, burned by low reimbursements, have stopped testing for the virus.
description: Across the United States, some doctors are seeing reimbursement rates so low that they do not cover the cost of the test supplies, jeopardizing access to a tool experts see as crucial to stopping the viruss spread.

title: Superspreader Sunday?
description: Coronavirus cases in the U.S. have surged after almost every major holiday of the past year, including Memorial Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving and Christmas. This weekend brings another major holiday, even if its not an official one: Super Bowl Sunday. And there is reason to worry that it will turn into Superspreader Sunday.

title: Why Your Kid Wears Shorts in Winter
description: The past three weekends, I have found myself shivering on the concrete of local playgrounds, because of my least favorite pandemic-related cultural change: outdoor childrens birthday parties in subarctic temperatures. I never thought I would miss the acrid smell of the dirty carpet at Brooklyns finest indoor bounce house emporium and mediocre pizza dispensary, but I really, really do. At least I didnt have to wear a parka and two sweaters inside.

title: Earwig and the Witch Review: Domestic Incantations
description: A strong-willed young heroine, a witch, a talking cat, cute magical minions: Earwig and the Witch has many of the familiar qualities of a Studio Ghibli film. And yet Ghiblis latest, directed by Goro Miyazaki, the son of the famed animator Hayao Miyazaki, uses ingredients from the tried-and-true Ghibli recipe while serving a film that lacks the heart the studio has always brought to its best.

title: Madonna? Harry Potter? Churchill? Tom Brady May Be Beyond Compare
description: The arc of Tom Bradys career  his rise to Super Bowl mainstay as quarterback of the New England Patriots and now with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers  reads as if it were a folk tale.

title: How Trumps Defense Is Coming Together
description: Trumps lawyers prepare two lines of defense, while Republicans in Congress mull their next move. Its Wednesday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: What Jeff Bezos Does Next
description: On Feb. 22-23, DealBook will convene some of the sharpest minds in business and policy for our DealBook DC Policy Project. Join us from anywhere in the world, free of charge. Register today.

title: Netflix Dominates Golden Globes Nods, With Mank and The Crown Leading the Way
description: Golden Globe nominators pulled David Finchers sleepy Mank and the revenge-driven Promising Young Woman deeper into the Oscar race on Wednesday, while embracing female directors, reacting somewhat coolly to Black ensemble films and, as ever, sprinkling honors on a wide range of stars, from first-timers to living legends.

title: Mario Draghi Gets Nod to Form New Government and Guide Italy Out of Crisis
description: ROME  Mario Draghi, the former head of the European Central Bank who is largely credited with helping to save the euro, accepted a mandate from Italys president on Wednesday to try and form a new unity government that would guide the country out of the pandemic and through economic recovery.

title: Iceland Has a Request for Disney+: More Icelandic, Please
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland  Iceland, like much of the world, has embraced Disneys popular streaming service, Disney+, since it arrived there late last year, with characters from Mickey Mouse to Mulan now available to watch on demand in homes across the country.

title: Anthony Davis Is the Teammate LeBron James Has Been Waiting For
description: Anthony Davis started to say that he and LeBron James blend together as a basketball duo with the made-for-each-other properties of peanut butter and jelly. Then Davis caught himself.

title: McCarthy condemns Marjorie Taylor Greenes statements but declines to remove her from committees.
description: Representative Kevin McCarthy, the top Republican, on Wednesday condemned Representative Marjorie Taylor Greenes past conspiratorial and violent comments, but he declined to take any action against her on the eve of a vote forced by Democrats to remove her from congressional committees.

title: More than 370 congressional aides call for Trumps conviction.
description: WASHINGTON  More than 370 Democratic congressional aides issued an unusual public appeal on Wednesday, imploring senators  in some cases their own bosses  to convict former President Donald J. Trump for inciting a violent attack on our workplace that threatened the peaceful transition of power.

title: Golden Globes 2021: A Full List of Nominees
description: The 78th Golden Globe Awards are scheduled for Feb. 28 and will be shown on NBC. Amy Poehler and Tina Fey will return to host the ceremony, which they last led in 2015.

title: Website Editor in Russia Is Jailed for Sharing Joke About Navalny Protests
description: MOSCOW  A Russian court on Wednesday sentenced the editor of a popular news website to 25 days in jail for retweeting a reference to an anti-Kremlin protest, the latest sign of an extraordinary crackdown on freedom of expression following the return to Russia last month of the opposition leader Aleksei A. Navalny.

title: Chapter 3: A House in Yorkshire
description: In a ruined palace in the woods, rummaging through discarded papers, our reporter finds a clue.

title: Tokyo Olympics Chief Apologizes for Remarks Demeaning Women
description: TOKYO  Organizers of the Tokyo Olympics, already facing rising costs and significant public opposition to this summers Games, faced a new furor on Wednesday after the president of the Tokyo organizing committee suggested women talk too much in meetings.

title: Why Long Beach Is a Model for the Vaccine Rollout
description: Good morning.

title: Court Faults France Over Ecological Damage From Its Emissions Levels
description: PARIS  A French court ruled on Wednesday that France had caused ecological damage by insufficiently reducing its greenhouse gas emissions, a landmark decision that environmentalists said they hoped would be more than merely symbolic as such cases are increasingly brought to courts internationally.

title: What You Get for $550,000
description: A prefabricated modern house in Madison, a brick colonial in Gloucester and a Greek Revival-style home in McComb.

title: $550,000 Homes in Wisconsin, Massachusetts and Mississippi
description: Erdman Homes, a manufacturer of prefabricated structures designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, produced this house taking cues from the architects work. It was conceived to be built into a hillside, if desired, with a two-car garage and additional rooms in the walkout basement.

title: Deep-Cleaning Videos Are Getting Grosser
description: A little over 12 minutes into the video Disaster Clean With Me 2021, Becky Moss holds her vacuums dirt cup up to the camera for inspection. Its filled with a powdery mound of gray dust and a swirl of pet hair. The volume of material  two or three cups worth, from the looks of it  seems excessive for one room. And yet, the accumulation is so satisfying to see.

title: A Republican move to punish Liz Cheney would create a pro-Trump litmus test for the party.
description: Representative Liz Cheney, the No. 3-ranking Republican in the House, has become the most visible and imperiled target of the pro-Trump majority in the G.O.P., and she faces possible punishment from them on Wednesday over her vote to impeach former President Donald J. Trump last month.

title: Tokyo Olympics Playbook: Testing? Yes. Quarantines? No. Fans? Maybe.
description: TOKYO  No cheering or singing.

title: Five Historic Acres on the Coast of St. Croix
description: This five-bedroom house on the mountainous northwest side of St. Croix, in the U.S. Virgin Islands, is on the market for $2.95 million.

title: House Hunting on St. Croix: A Converted Sugar Mill With Sea Views
description: This five-bedroom property claims nearly five hilltop acres on the mountainous northwest end of St. Croix, in the U.S. Virgin Islands. The 5,545-square-foot house is built in and around an 18th-century sugar mill, though most of it was constructed of concrete and stone in the early 1990s, after Hurricane Hugo demolished a more modest wood home on the site.

title: Super Bowl Commercials: To Address or Avoid the Pandemic?
description: Some of the biggest players on Super Bowl Sunday wont be wearing helmets. Theyre the company executives and ad makers who will be monitoring the reaction to the big-budget commercials that will have their television debuts before an expected audience of 100 million viewers.

title: 3 National Guard Pilots Are Killed in a Helicopter Crash in Idaho
description: Three Idaho Army National Guard pilots were killed when their helicopter crashed in bad weather on Tuesday night during a routine training mission, the Guard said Wednesday.

title: Len Dawson Is Better Than Patrick Mahomes: A Sentimental Dads Argument
description: My son, Jack, is a teenager, so there is a lot we disagree on. Curfews. Sleep habits. The greatest rapper of all time. (He tells me Led Zeppelin doesnt count.) The position Im dug in on, unwisely, is this:

title: An Invisible Cost of College: Parental Guilt
description: Many of us put our heads in the sand when it comes to confronting the cost of college for our kids, and Ive spent the last several years trying to figure out why.

title: In the Vaccine Scramble, Cancer Patients Are Left Behind
description: A doctor in Arizona says her cancer patients are so desperate to get vaccinated against Covid-19 that they plan to volunteer at a stadium vaccination site. A woman in New Jersey with colon cancer cant sign up for a vaccine appointment because her cancer center, in New York, is authorized to vaccinate only state residents. A cancer patient in Maryland refreshes and refreshes her computer, but cant find an available vaccination appointment.

title: Celeste, a Young Singer With an Old Soul, Makes Her Move
description: The best way to learn about Celeste, the rising British soul singer and songwriter with a gift for channeling earlier eras, is to ask about her songs.

title: 5 Art Accounts to Follow on Instagram Now
description: In the years B.C.  Before Covid-19  I was convinced that museums and Instagram were fundamentally opponents. Both are storehouses of images, classified, displayed and valorized according to certain governing rules. But whereas museums locate the importance of pictures in their artistic value or their historical lineage, Instagram ascribes value through a simpler, tougher logic: the tyranny of likes.

title: All the Worlds a Screen? Theyre Used to It
description: About a year ago, when such things were possible, a friend and I bought cheap, same-day tickets to a preview of West Side Story, directed by the Belgian auteur Ivo van Hove. Our assigned seats were in the second row of the orchestra, on the extreme left, below the lip of the stage. Which means that we saw most of the performance via the 30-foot-tall LED display at the back.

title: Scenes From a Marriage, Patinkin-Style
description: Mandy Patinkin and Kathryn Grody have been together since their first date nearly 43 years ago, a giddy daylong romp through Greenwich Village that began with brunch and ended with them making out on a street corner. Im going to marry you, he declared. Youre going to get hurt, because Im not going to marry anyone, she replied.

title: Pension Funds Are Mixed or Mum on More Cash for Apollo
description: When investors in Apollo Global Management learned last week that the firms chief executive had paid $158 million to the registered sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, they hardly blinked.

title: Trumps Banker at Deutsche Bank Was Ousted for a Real Estate Deal
description: Former President Donald J. Trumps longtime banker at Deutsche Bank was pushed out of her job in December following an internal investigation that concluded that she did business with a client without properly disclosing it, according to regulatory records that were made public on Wednesday.

title: Golden Globes Movies Snubs: Da 5 Bloods and Meryl Streep Are Shut Out
description: With the Golden Globes, its best to expect the unexpected, and during an awards season this atypical, theres an even higher chance of weird and wacky nominations. Thats why, though major movies like Nomadland and The Trial of the Chicago 7 scored when the Golden Globe nominations were announced on Wednesday, its the out-of-left-field picks and startling exclusions that have everybody in Hollywood talking.

title: Modis Response to Farmer Protests in India Stirs Fears of a Pattern
description: NEW DELHI  First came the accusations of foreign infiltration. Police complaints against protest leaders followed, as did arrests of protesters and journalists. Then the government blocked internet access in places where demonstrators gathered.

title: Get Ready for Lunar New Year
description: Good morning. Andrea Nguyen has a lovely story in The Times this week about family celebrations of Tet, the Vietnamese holiday observed on the Lunar New Year, which this year falls on Feb. 12.

title: A Painter Explores His Royal Roots
description: PARIS  Even the palace doors were carted away. When French forces colonized the kingdom of Dahomey in the 1890s, they overthrew the ruler, King Behanzin, and looted everything left behind: elaborate thrones; ceremonial scepters; half man, half animal statues. The priceless treasures ended up in museums in France.

title: I May Destroy You Is Shut Out by Golden Globes
description: Unpredictability is the biggest weakness of the TV portion of the Golden Globes, and also its greatest strength. You can usually count on the Globess handful of voters to make some baffling choices as well as to celebrate some deserving but obscure nominees that the Emmys overlook.

title: Art Gallery Shows to See Right Now
description: New York City art galleries form a resilient and irrepressible ecosystem, one that has survived recessions, gentrification, at least one hurricane, and now an aggressive pandemic. Through everything, the system continues to sprout new life. The group show Downtown 2021, curated by the artist Sam Gordon, pays homage to this phenomenon by giving more than two dozen galleries their hardscrabble props.

title: 5 Tips for Playing Outside in the Snow
description: Heres what you need to know to spend more time outdoors with your kids (and enjoy it).

title: These People Really Did Not Want to Give Up Their Hot Yoga
description: After the pandemic left fitness studios and gyms around the country shuttered or operating at reduced capacity, Margaux Drake let her regular yoga practice go.

title: What Can You Actually Buy With Bitcoin?
description: In the last twelve months, the value of a single unit of Bitcoin has risen from less than $10,000 to more than $30,000. Companies including Square and IBM are using blockchain, the technology behind the currency, to design and improve digital payments methods.

title: Home of Brooklyn Abolitionists Receives Landmark Status
description: After a 20-year effort by activists to save it from destruction, a rowhouse in Downtown Brooklyn received landmark status Tuesday for its connection to the antislavery movement of the 1800s.

title: The Need to Spend Without Delay in Battling the Coronavirus
description: The United States is in grave danger of repeating a central error: reacting to the coronavirus, instead of getting ahead of it.

title: These Lizards Have a Hot Trick to Escape Hungry Snakes
description: Masami Hasegawa was just an undergraduate student when he first visited the Izu Islands of Japan in 1977. Every year since, he has taken the eight-hour ferry ride from Tokyo southeast to this cluster of volcanic islands to pursue a passion he has had since childhood: catching lizards.

title: Live Webinar: Teaching Argumentative Writing
description: Each year, The Learning Networks Editorial Contest provides students a platform to write short, evidence-based persuasive essays like the editorials The New York Times publishes every day. Thousands of students participate annually.

title: A YouTuber Shoots to Literary Fame in France, Ruffling Feathers
description: PARIS  Lna Situations shot to fame in France by sharing fashion advice and tips for living a positive life with millions of her followers on social media.

title: The Justice Dept. drops a lawsuit accusing Yale of discriminating against Asian-American and white applicants.
description: The Justice Department on Wednesday withdrew a lawsuit against Yale that charged the university with discriminating against Asian-American and white applicants for admission, another reversal by the new administration of a Trump-era policy.

title: Academic Facing Jail in Iran Escapes to U.K.
description: LONDON  A British-Iranian academic who was sentenced in Iran to nine years and three months in prison for cooperating with a hostile state has fled the country and is now in Britain, he said on Wednesday.

title: She Escaped Pakistan. Now Her Father Has Been Thrown Into Jail.
description: NEW DELHI  Gulalai Ismail, one of Pakistans boldest human rights defenders and a stalwart critic of Pakistans security services, succeeded in escaping an enormous dragnet and making it to the United States in 2019, deeply humiliating the authorities who had been persecuting her.

title: Country Star Morgan Wallen Rebuked by Music Business After Using Racial Slur
description: Morgan Wallen, one of country musics biggest new stars, was swiftly rebuked on Wednesday by major radio stations, streaming services, record labels, fellow artists and the CMT network after a video surfaced of him using a racial slur.

title: What We're Reading Now
description: Even for those of us who read for a living, theres nothing better than diving into a new book.

title: Chicago Families Debate School Reopening
description: After days of rising tension between Mayor Lori Lightfoot and the Chicago Teachers Union, we are now in the midst of what local officials are calling a 48-hour cooling off period. Students are continuing to learn remotely as the two sides try to avoid a strike or lockout.

title: Sham Justice for Navalny in Putins Fief
description: To the Editor:

title: Rennie Davis, Chicago Seven Antiwar Activist, Dies at 80
description: Rennie Davis, who lived out one of the more quixotic journeys of the 1960s generation when he went from leading opponent of the Vietnam War, as a convicted member of the Chicago Seven, to spokesman for a teenage Indian guru, died on Tuesday at his home in Berthoud, Colo. He was 80.

title: Canada Formally Declares Proud Boys a Terrorist Group
description: OTTAWA  Canada formally designated the Proud Boys as a terrorist group under its criminal law on Wednesday, a move that could lead to financial seizures and allow police to treat any crimes committed by members as terrorist activity.

title: The Courage to Put Country Over Party: Arguments in Trumps Trial
description: To the Editor:

title: Amazon Without Jeff Bezos
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: As the Tennis Party in Australia Begins, an Uncertain Year Awaits
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  By sheer force of will, professional tennis inched toward normalcy this week, with a flurry of events in a country that has managed to nearly smother the coronavirus.

title: Theater to Stream: Shakespeare Villains and Hot-Tub Dreams
description: Dark and wintry days, cold nights: February is the perfect time to cuddle up with some so-called chiller theater.

title: The Shift Toward Clean Cars
description: Toyota, Fiat Chrysler and several other big automakers said this week they would no longer try to block California from setting its own strict fuel-economy standards. The move signaled that the auto industry as a whole is now ready to work with President Biden on one of his main efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: These Women Were N.F.L. Firsts. Theyre Eager for Company.
description: The football pioneers arrived quickly over the past year: the first woman to coach in a Super Bowl, the first woman chosen to officiate a Super Bowl, the first Black woman to be named a full-time coach in the N.F.L.

title: Some Trump loyalists in the Dept. of Homeland Security could actively resist Bidens immigration policies.
description: After a Texas judge last week temporarily blocked President Bidens order to pause deportations for 100 days, immigration agents did not hesitate to use the brief window to defy the incoming presidents new tone.

title: New Jersey Eases Indoor Coronavirus Restrictions
description: Gov. Philip D. Murphy said New Jersey would lift its statewide 10 p.m. indoor dining curfew and raise capacity limits on a number of indoor businesses, including restaurants, from 25 percent to 35 percent.

title: Supreme Court Rules for Germany in Case on Nazi-Era Art
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday unanimously ruled against the heirs of Jewish art dealers in Nazi-era Frankfurt who sought to sue Germany in American courts over artifacts they say the dealers were forced to sell for a third of their value.

title: After a Rocky Start, Novavax Vaccine Could Be Here by Summer
description: As recently as December, the vaccine maker Novavax appeared to once again be on the brink of failure.

title: Bringing Out the Best of Sondheim, Herman and  Schraubstader?
description: It may be that a million songs have been deposited for copyright in the United States since 1900. So why do we keep hearing the same 25 in revues?

title: Allan Burns, a Creator of The Mary Tyler Moore Show, Dies at 85
description: Allan Burns, a leading television writer in the 1970s and 80s who helped create the groundbreaking hit sitcom The Mary Tyler Moore Show and its dramatic spinoff, Lou Grant, died on Jan. 30 at his home in Los Angeles. He was 85.

title: Archaeologists Find Mummies With Golden Tongues
description: Archaeologists working at a temple on the outskirts of the Egyptian city of Alexandria have found 16 human burial chambers there, the governments ministry of tourism and antiquities announced on Friday.

title: U.S. Should Slow Withdrawal From Afghanistan, Bipartisan Panel Urges
description: WASHINGTON  The Biden administration should slow the withdrawal of troops in Afghanistan, abandon the May 1 exit deadline and instead reduce American forces further only as security conditions improve, a congressionally appointed panel recommended Wednesday.

title: My Country Suddenly Turned on Me
description: Few moments of my life have taught me so much about America as the time my friend Franklin stabbed me with a pencil in 9th grade. This was in Ancient History class, where instead of listening to Mr. Dripps (his actual name) explain about the Hittites, I was doing an imitation imitation  you know, like an impression of Carol Channing imitating Jimmy Stewart.

title: Whats in Your Prenatal Vitamin?
description: When I told my doctor that I was thinking of getting pregnant a few years ago, she advised me to start taking a prenatal vitamin right away. So I stopped by the grocery store on my way home and made for the supplement aisle. As I studied the array of options before me, I quickly grew overwhelmed.

title: Biden to Welcome More Refugees, but Far From All Will Get In
description: WASHINGTON  President Bidens expected announcement on Thursday that he intends to allow more refugees into the United States this year will bring him face to face with a policy barrier left by his predecessor: a gutted resettlement system unable to quickly process the tens of thousands of desperate people whom Mr. Biden would like to let in.

title: Demonstrators in Bangkok Protest Myanmar Military Coup
description: Supporters of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, Myanmars civilian leader who was ousted by the military in a coup, expressed their opposition in Bangkok on Wednesday.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The countrys civilian leader, who was deposed by the military in a coup, was charged on Wednesday with having illegally imported at least 10 walkie-talkies, according to an official from her party. A conviction could be punishable by up to three years in prison.

title: A poll shows most Americans, including many Republicans, support $1,400 stimulus checks.
description: A huge majority of Americans, including nearly two-thirds of Republicans, support the $1,400 stimulus checks President Biden is calling for, and his full $1.9 trillion stimulus proposal also has strong public backing, according to a new poll from Quinnipiac University.

title: A Breakout Portrait Artist Invested in Asian Representation
description: A little more than 14 years ago, the Thai-born, Lyon-based artist Jiab Prachakul went to the National Portrait Gallery in London to see a David Hockney show. In the second room of the exhibition, she stood before Mr. and Mrs. Clark and Percy (1970-71)  Hockneys famous painting of the fashion designer Ossie Clark, the textile designer Celia Birtwell and their pristine white cat  and had an epiphany. Prachakul, who had just left her job as a casting associate for an advertising production house, thought, All the great artists, they are not great from the beginning. If you have the talent, you have to develop it. And that, she recalls, when we meet via Zoom on a recent early morning in France and very early morning in America, is when I thought, I want to become an artist.

title: June Rose Bellamy, Adventurous Burmese Princess, Dies at 88
description: Her father was an Australian bookie and adventurer. Her mother was a princess, a scion of the Konbaung dynasty, the last royal family of Burma (now Myanmar). They met while betting on the racetracks in Rangoon (now Yangon), the capital, and it was she who proposed.

title: Parrish Art Museum Announces New Director
description: The Parrish Art Museum, which showcases work by Long Island artists, announced Wednesday that Kelly Taxter will be its next director. She succeeds Terrie Sultan, who helmed the museum for 12 years before stepping down in June.

title: New Vaccine Puzzle: Who Should Get Which Shot?
description: LONDON  First came the good news. The European Union authorized a third vaccine.

title: Birthdays in Quarantine
description: Welcome. Take five minutes today and let The Timess classical music writers and some of their favorite artists convince you to fall in love with string quartets. I spent my five with the musician and producer Rostam Batmanglijs pick, the second movement of Ravels Quartet, an easy courtship.

title: Richard Feigen, Gallerist and Champion of Art, Dies at 90
description: Richard L. Feigen, a prominent gallerist, dealer and collector whose influence in the art world in New York and beyond included brokering top-dollar deals of all sorts for museums and magnates while championing both old masters and new talent, died on Jan. 29 in Mount Kisco, N.Y. He was 90.

title: Who Wants to Be Mayor of New York City?
description: The race for the next mayor of New York City may be one of the most consequential elections in a generation. Here are some of the leading candidates vying to run the nations largest city.

title: N.Y. Repeals Law That Critics Say Criminalized Walking While Trans
description: ALBANY, N.Y.  For decades, a state loitering law, originally designed to discourage street prostitution, was interpreted far more broadly, resulting in what civil rights advocates said was a pattern of police harassment of anyone who they viewed as looking different or suspicious.

title: Killing of F.B.I. Agents Comes Amid Explosion of Child Sex Abuse Reports
description: SUNRISE, Fla.  While investigating a tip late last year about a man suspected of possessing child sexual abuse imagery, deputies from the sheriffs office in Walton County, Fla., worried that executing a search warrant might be dangerous: The man lived in an isolated area, kept strange hours and was thought to have a secret bunker.

title: Texas Department Apologizes for Chucky Amber Alert
description: An Amber Alert sent to Texans last week warned that a child had been abducted by Chucky, a 28-year-old male with red or auburn hair and blue eyes who stands 3 feet 1 inch tall. His race was given as Other: Doll.

title: A GameStop Evangelists Videos Draw a Regulators Attention
description: Moonlighting under the name Roaring Kitty, Keith Gill became something of an online folk hero for his dedication to GameStop, the struggling video-game retailer at the center of a trading frenzy that sent its share price into the stratosphere.

title: How Andy Jassy, Amazons Next C.E.O., Was a Brain Double for Jeff Bezos
description: SEATTLE  In 2002, Andy Jassy, a young executive at Amazon, began closely shadowing Jeff Bezos, the founder of the online bookstore.

title: Declaring Democracy Wont Be Subverted, Biden Demands Russia and Myanmar Reverse Course
description: WASHINGTON  Two weeks after taking office, President Biden has demanded that Myanmar reverse a coup dtat and that Russia release its most famous dissident politician, Aleksei A. Navalny, whose arrest and sentencing incited protests of a size and intensity that surprised officials here, and most likely inside the Kremlin.

title: Jeff Bezos Renews Focus on Blue Origin, Which Has Been Slower to Launch
description: For most of its two decades of existence, Blue Origin was like Willy Wonkas chocolate factory in the childrens book by Roald Dahl.

title: In a first, a federal judge orders Oregon state prisons to vaccinate inmates.
description: A federal court judge in Oregon has ordered the state prison system to inoculate every inmate who wants to be vaccinated against Covid-19. The order, the first in the nation, comes as many states have declined to make vaccinating prisoners a priority, even though severe virus outbreaks inside prisons have been common.

title: Lloyd Austin ramps up the fight against right-wing extremism within the military.
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III convened the military chiefs and civilian secretaries of the armed forces on Wednesday to begin intensifying the Pentagons efforts to combat white supremacy and right-wing extremism in the ranks.

title: Analysis: Fights over Greene and Cheney are bad news for a weakened McCarthy, less of a problem for McConnell.
description: On Wednesday, Democrats hurtled toward a Thursday vote on stripping committee assignments from Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene, Republican of Georgia, over comments and social media posts promoting QAnon conspiracies and anti-Jewish tropes.

title: Jim Justice, a G.O.P. Governor, on Why Biden Needs to Go Big on Covid Aid
description: The odds that Democrats will succeed in passing a large economic rescue package received a boost this week from an unexpected source: Gov. Jim Justice of West Virginia, a Republican. Mr. Justice said on Monday, in back-to-back interviews with CNN and MSNBC, that Congress should go big and not worry about the federal deficit.

title: U.S. vaccine numbers just took a dip. But it might not mean all that much.
description: An important metric for understanding the state of the U.S. coronavirus vaccine rollout took a dip on Tuesday. Should it be cause for concern?

title: N.Y.P.D. Anti-Harassment Official Fired Over Racist Online Rants
