description: WASHINGTON  As a candidate, President Biden left no doubt what he thought about how the United States should deal with Saudi Arabia.

title: Helping People Find Covid-19 Vaccines Is Aim of C.D.C.-Backed Site
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, hoping to make it easier for Americans to find Covid-19 vaccines, is backing the test of a centralized online portal where the public can search for nearby vaccination locations with doses on hand.

title: Ready to Nag About Gun Control?
description: You may be wondering how were doing on gun control.

title: Criminal Justice Is a State Issue
description: This week, Illinois became the first state to eliminate its cash bail system, and Virginia became the first Southern state to abolish the death penalty. These developments illustrate that many of the most impactful criminal justice reforms can and must be enacted by states, not by the federal government.

title: Black History Continued
description: This series explores pivotal moments and transformative figures in Black culture.

title: Golf Without Tiger Woods? His Fellow Players Can Barely Imagine
description: BRADENTON, Fla.  As a golf prodigy growing up in Northern Ireland, Rory McIlroy not only yearned to compete against his idol Tiger Woods but also hoped to become his good friend. Both dreams came true.

title: California has now lost more people to Covid-19 than any other state in the U.S.
description: Its really hard to put all of it into words.

title: Biden Revokes Trumps Pause on Green Cards
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden reopened the country on Wednesday to people seeking green cards, ending a ban on legal immigration that President Donald J. Trump imposed last spring, citing what he said was the need to protect American jobs during the pandemic.

title: How Negro History Week Became Black History Month and Why It Matters Now
description: Black History Month has been celebrated in the United States for close to 100 years but what is it exactly and how did it begin?

title: Ghana Receives First Vaccine Shipment Through Covax
description: Ghana on Wednesday became the first country to receive a shipment of coronavirus vaccines through the World Health Organizations Covax distribution program.

title: Like Beige and Lilac
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  I hope it comes as no surprise that I, the writer of a column about crossword puzzles, have many niche interests. With that in mind, this puzzle scratched a number of itches for me: Obscure car models and makers, quirks of citations, cartographic lingo and card games are all present in this grid.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The West African nation of Ghana received 600,000 doses of Covid-19 vaccines, the first major shipment under Covax, a global sharing program that aims to deliver two billion free doses to 92 low- and middle-income countries this year.

title: Facebook Takes a Side, Barring Myanmar Military After Coup
description: Facebook said on Wednesday that it had barred Myanmars military from its platforms, weeks after the countrys fragile democratic government was overthrown in a military coup.

title: Quotation of the Day: Mental Health and Homeless Crises Collided in Subway Attacks
description: She didnt have to be sleeping on the trains and die the way she did.

title: Corrections: Feb. 25, 2021
description: An article on Wednesday about a car crash involving Tiger Woods and his subsequent surgery misstated when Mr. Woods recently underwent a procedure on his spine called a microdiscectomy. It was in December, not January.

title: More Adult Americans Are Identifying as L.G.B.T., Gallup Poll Finds
description: A Gallup survey released Wednesday has found that more adult Americans are identifying as L.G.B.T., a shift that pollsters see as driven, at least in part, by people in younger generations who are more likely to consider themselves to be something other than heterosexual.

title: When the Romance Ends, but the Brand Goes On
description: Normally in January, Tamara Ralph presents a runway extravaganza as part of Paris couture week. This year, however, Ms. Ralph, the creative director of Ralph & Russo, alongside her longtime partner in life and business, Michael Russo, decided to postpone the latest collection because of the pandemic.

title: Late Night Laughs Off Mike Pences Renewed Loyalty to Trump
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word + Quiz: tangible
Squealing Children and Noisy Neighbors? Theres a Map for That
description: Noisy children skateboarding on the streets. Couples arguing in their homes. People gathered on the sidewalk, gossiping for long hours. Some people would describe these activities as noise pollution. A new website in Japan has put perpetrators on a map, spurring debate about those who disturb the peace.

title: Behind the Curtain
When an Actor Calls With a Poem to Share
description: PARIS  I am calling you for a poetic consultation, said a warm voice on the telephone. It all starts with a very simple question: How are you?

title: Lesson of the Day: What Students Are Saying About Race and Racism in America
description: Featured Article: What Students Are Saying About Race and Racism in America by Nicole Daniels (also available as a PDF)

title: Ibram X. Kendi Likes to Read at Bedtime
description: I dont remember the last time the pages of a book were not the final thing I saw before departing off for sleep, says the author, professor and editor, with Keisha Blain, of Four Hundred Souls: A Community History of African America, 1619-2019.

title: This Indigenous Author and Artist Team Have an Important Message
description: DYNAMIC DUO At the end of January, Michaela Goade became the first Indigenous artist to win the Randolph Caldecott Medal, which is one of the most illustrious distinctions awarded for childrens books  the literary equivalent of an Oscar, with a gold seal instead of a statuette.

title: Nursing Homes, Once Hotspots, Far Outpace U.S. in Covid Declines
description: New cases among residents of nursing homes have dropped more than 80 percent since vaccines became available, and deaths have decreased by more than 65 percent.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Crouton Snacking
description: Nate writes: I buy croutons because otherwise my salads are boring. The other day, I found my partner shoving fistfuls of them in her mouth. I asked her not to. We bought some other snacks, but she was eating the croutons the next day. Is it fair for me to ask that they serve their purpose?

title: The Goal: A One-Bedroom With a View in Queens for Less Than $650,000. Which Option Would You Choose?
description: Recently widowed, he returned to his home borough after 40 years in the New Jersey suburbs. Could he find the home he wanted at his budget?

title: Searching for Our Urban Future in the Ruins of the Past
description: FOUR LOST CITIES

title: My Year of Grief and Cancellation
description: If you were on Tumblr in the early 2010s, you may remember a blog called Your Fave Is Problematic. If not, its content should still sound familiar to you. The posts contained long lists of celebrities regrettable (racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, ethnophobic, ableist and so on) statements and actions  the stuff that gets people canceled these days.

title: To Light Up a Dark Time, Effervescent Poems of New York City
description: LOVE AND OTHER POEMSBy Alex Dimitrov

title: Should There Be More Gender Options on Identification Documents?
description: Do you think that identification documents like passports and birth certificates should include a gender option for people who do not identify as male or female? Why or why not?

title: Poem: A New Day Dawns
description: I went to William Beanes Elementary, where I learned that Beanes was a medical doctor who was captured by the British during the War of 1812. Francis Scott Key went with John Skinner to secure Beaness freedom. That trip ended with Key seeing the image of a flag that would become The Star-Spangled Banner. In this poem, Nikky Finney is talking about what it means to stop flying some flags. Makes you wonder: How is it a flag can divide and unite a people? And if it does the former, why would we ever argue that it should remain? Selected by Reginald Dwayne Betts

title: These Young Podcasters Are Growing Up on Mic
description: Before Tai Poole could kick off the third season of his podcast for the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Tai Asks Why, he needed to address a change in the shows sound. Specifically, his voice.

title: Ad Council vaccine campaign begins rolling out nationwide.
description: A broad promotional effort to combat Covid-19 vaccine skepticism began rolling out on Thursday, backed by the nonprofit advertising group Ad Council and a coalition of experts known as the Covid Collaborative.

title: Why Plus Is a Minus When Naming Your Streaming Site
description: First there was e.

title: Learning to Listen to Patients Stories
description: The pandemic has been a time of painful social isolation for many. Few places can be as isolating as hospitals, where patients are surrounded by strangers, subject to invasive tests and attached to an assortment of beeping and gurgling machines.

title: Will Anything Stop Putins Pet Project?
description: After the imprisonment this month of the opposition leader Aleksei Navalny, punishing Russia is back on the agenda. On Monday, European Union foreign ministers agreed to impose sanctions on Russian officials, with the final details to come.

title: How to Keep Extremists Out of Power
description: American democracy faces alarming risks from extremist forces that have rapidly gained ground in our politics. The most urgent focus of political reform must be to marginalize, to the extent possible, these destabilizing forces.

title: In China, an Electric Car Maker Loses Money but Thinks Big
description: HEFEI, China  Walk around the sprawling auto factory in central China, and the wealth pouring into the countrys electric car industry quickly becomes clear.

title: Covid-19 Is Probably Going to End My Career
description: When the Covid-19 pandemic hit New York this spring, Jessica Fink wanted to help. Shes been a nurse for 15 years, and she moved from Delaware to serve at Stony Brook University Hospital on Long Island.

title: Can Clubhouse Move Fast Without Breaking Things?
description: A few nights ago, after my weekly trip to the grocery store, I sat in my car glued to Clubhouse, the invitation-only social audio app.

title: Sacha Baron Cohen Has a Message for Mark Zuckerberg
description: Sacha Baron Cohen was busy last year. In The Trial of The Chicago 7, he portrayed 1960s antiwar activist Abbie Hoffman. In Borat Subsequent Moviefilm, he revived his role as a Kazakh journalist touring America. These films may seem historical or comedic, respectively, but Baron Cohen says their themes  abuse of political power, misogyny and disinformation  are reflective of our current reality. He blames two things: Donald Trump and social media.

title: This Is the Coat to Wear to Davos
description: Seven years ago, when Michael Berkowitz, 34, was a physical commodities trader in New York, he found that the best time to talk to his busy boss was on walks. If he was going to a nearby meeting and I needed face time with him, I would walk him there, Mr. Berkowitz said.

title: The Supreme Court Is Not Finished With Elections
description: When the Supreme Court on Monday rejected Pennsylvania Republicans after-the-fact effort to invalidate late-arriving mailed ballots, it was tempting to suppose that the countrys courthouse doors had finally closed on this most litigated of presidential elections.

title: Vaccine Hesitancy in Cancer Patients
description: Do the vaccines against the coronavirus offer cancer patients the same hope that they hold out to healthy people? The women in my cancer support group expressed hesitancy as the vaccines started to be administered to health care workers.

title: How Food Traditions Nourish New Moms
description: When Jennifer Chowdhury, a New York City-based journalist, gave birth to a baby girl three months ago, her Bangladeshi mother and maternal aunt fed her kalijira bhorta, or black cumin mash, in the immediate postpartum period. Kalijira bhorta is an aromatic and flavorful dish, often seasoned with garlic and mustard oil, and served with rice. Bengalis also believe it stimulates lochia, or postpartum vaginal discharge, and increases milk supply.

title: What to Watch For at CPAC: Trump, Cruz, Pompeo and More
description: Starting on Friday, a medley of conservative politicians, commentators and activists will descend on Orlando, Fla., for the annual Conservative Political Action Conference, commonly known as CPAC. In years past, the event has been a reliable barometer for the base of the Republican Party, clarifying how its most devout members define the institution now, and what they want it to look like in the future.

title: Texas Is a Rich State in a Rich Country, and Look What Happened
description: A few months back, because I really know how to live, I spent a night reading The Green Swan: Central banking and financial stability in the age of climate change. The report, released in January 2020 by the Bank for International Settlements, argued that central banks, concerned as they are with the stability of prices and financial systems, were negligent if they ignored climate change. The economies we know are inseparable from the long climatic peace in which they were built. But that peace is ending. There are no stable prices in a burning world.

title: Want to Be Mayor of New York? Better Know Your Wings and Dumplings
description: Among all the things that help shape a New York City mayors image, its not always the most consequential topics that tend to stick  especially on matters that concern food.

title: What Happens When a Publisher Becomes a Megapublisher?
description: When Penguin Random House said last year that it planned to buy Simon & Schuster for more than $2 billion, the entire publishing industry snapped to attention.

title: For Travel, a Sustainable Comeback?
description: With travel stalled for the past 10 months, its sustainable comeback has been a popular topic. Now with Covid-19 vaccines in distribution, and the prospect of travel reviving later this year, some travel operators, local governments and nonprofit organizations are walking the talk, with new eco-oriented programs, trips, transportation initiatives and preserves.

title: For Shielding Endangered Neighbors, Pandas Make Flimsy Umbrellas
description: Like many undergraduate biology students, Fang Wang was taught that pandas are a prime example of an umbrella species  a charismatic, well-known and usually endangered animal whose protection benefits an entire ecosystem and all the wildlife that lives there.

title: Podcasting Is Booming. Will Hollywood Help or Hurt Its Future?
description: In November, production began in Los Angeles on a new series with the trappings of a potential hit.

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
description: In October, New York City Center reimagined its popular Fall for Dance festival in digital form: Dancers made use of the stage of the empty theater, their performances broadcast to audiences at home. In honor of Black History Month, three of those presentations are streaming again  Lady Swings the Blues by the brilliant tap artist Dormeshia; Kyle Abrahams to be seen, danced to Ravels Bolro by Calvin Royal III of American Ballet Theater; and Morani/Mungu (Black Warrior/Black God) by Jamar Roberts, a longtime member of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater and that companys resident choreographer.

title: V.I.P. Immunization for the Powerful and Their Cronies Rattles South America
description: LIMA, Peru  The hope brought by the arrival of the first vaccines in South America is hardening into anger as inoculation campaigns have spiraled into scandal, cronyism and corruption, rocking national governments and sapping trust in the political establishment.

title: The Retired Boys of Summer Play On
description: The Retired Boys of Summer were not going to let a pandemic  or a little rain  interrupt their game.

title: How the Pandemic Nearly Tore Israel Apart
description: On Jan 31, one month after Israel declared its third lockdown of the pandemic, Rabbi Meshulam Dovid Soloveitchik succumbed to the coronavirus at 99. Soloveitchik was the head of the Brisk Yeshiva in Jerusalem, an elite school for ultra-Orthodox Jews, and as news of his death spread, thousands of followers prepared to mourn him. A grand funeral was required, and according to tradition, it would need to take place as soon as possible.

title: 36 Podcast Personalities Recommend Their Favorite Shows
description: We might not commute anymore. We might not go to the gym. Errands are fewer. Listening opportunities have shrunk. Still, the podcast episodes keep coming. In a year when many of us had to encounter the world audibly rather than actually, we asked some of our favorite podcast personalities to recommend their own favorites, new and enduring. Here are their answers, lightly edited.

title: How a TV Critic Turned to Podcasts During a Pandemic
description: In a year otherwise defined by loss, one area of our lives has remained untouched; abundant, even. Movie theaters closed and blockbusters were delayed. Music and theater venues shuttered. But TV marched on. The number of original scripted shows dipped slightly, but international series and older shows arriving on the streaming platforms more than filled the void of shows canceled or delayed.

title: Saidu Tejan-Thomas Jr. and the Voices of Resistance
description: In late 2018, Saidu Tejan-Thomas Jr. (pronounced sai-eed) heard something he couldnt get out of his head.

title: Public dismay turns to anger as South American officials jump the line for vaccines.
description: The hope brought by the arrival of the first vaccines in South America is hardening into anger as inoculation campaigns have spiraled into scandal, cronyism and corruption, rocking national governments and sapping trust in the political establishment.

title: The pandemic has put some governors in the crosshairs. Just ask Gavin Newsom.
description: Long before Orrin Heatlie filed recall papers, he knew the odds were against unseating Gavin Newsom, the suave ex-mayor of San Francisco who had ascended to become Californias governor.

title: What Are the Vaccine Roadblocks Where You Live?
description: U.S. counties should prepare to overcome serious barriers to widespread vaccination. And vaccine hesitancy is only the tip of the iceberg.

title: Former Aide Says Cuomo Kissed Me on the Lips
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Fate, Domestic Terrorism and the Nomination of Merrick Garland
description: Five years ago, Judge Merrick B. Garland became a high-profile casualty of Washingtons political dysfunction. President Barack Obama selected him to fill the Supreme Court vacancy created by the death of Justice Antonin Scalia, but Senate Republicans blocked his nomination. In the process, Mr. Garland became known for the job he didnt get.

title: The Future of Car Navigation Has Arrived
description: The next time your cars navigation system takes you right to the front door of a perfect little back-road barbecue joint, thank the U.S. military.

title: Nursing Home Deaths Plummet
description: There are two new pieces of encouraging news about the pandemic  and two worrisome developments. Lets take them one at a time, starting with the positive.

title: Jobless Claims Decline as Coronavirus Cases Ease
description: New claims for unemployment fell last week, the government reported on Thursday, the latest sign that the labor markets recovery, however slow and unsteady, is continuing.

title: The Biden administration hopes Katherine Tai can heal divisions over trade.
description: The Biden administration is hoping that its nominee for U. S. trade representative, Katherine Tai, who is scheduled to appear for her confirmation hearing on Thursday morning before the Senate Finance Committee, can serve as a consensus builder and help bridge the Democratic Partys varying views on trade, Ana Swanson reports for The New York Times.

title: Costco Will Raise Its Minimum Wage to $16 an Hour
description: The chief executive of Costco waded into the political debate over the federal minimum wage, testifying at a Senate hearing on Thursday that the retailer was raising its starting pay to $16 an hour.

title: Pfizer will test a booster shot and develop an adapted vaccine to address variant concerns.
description: As concerns grow that new coronavirus variants could blunt the protective effects of vaccines, Pfizer and BioNTech said on Thursday that they planned to test a third booster shot as well as update their original vaccine.

title: Un Film Dramatique Review: Students Record the Paris Suburbs
description: In the documentary Un Film Dramatique, the artist ric Baudelaire fulfills a commission to make a dedicated artwork for Dora Maar, a newly constructed middle school in the Saint-Denis suburb of Paris. For the project, Baudelaire filmed 21 students across four years, and he encouraged them to take up the camera themselves. The finished film demonstrates the liveliness and generosity that can come from civic-minded art.

title: The Father Review: A Capricious Mind
description: At once stupendously effective and profoundly upsetting, The Father might be the first movie about dementia to give me actual chills. On its face a simple, uncomfortably familiar story about the heartbreaking mental decline of a beloved parent, this first feature from the French novelist and playwright Florian Zeller plays with perspective so cleverly that maintaining any kind of emotional distance is impossible.

title: The Vigil Review: What Could Go Wrong Watching Over the Dead?
description: It is Jewish tradition to have someone watch over the dead until they are buried. That person is called a shomer. Yakov (Dave Davis), a young Jewish man who has left behind a strictly Jewish-observant life, is pulled into last-minute night-watch shomer duty. Hes reluctant but could desperately use the $400 that he is promised. What could go wrong with just a few hours spent next to a dead body, anyway?

title: Crisis Review: Finding a Fix
description: Applying the panoramic approach of Steven Soderberghs Traffic to the subject matter of, well, Traffic, Crisis examines the intractability of the opioid epidemic through a three-pronged narrative. The writer-director, Nicholas Jarecki, who made the engrossing, Bonfire of the Vanities-ish thriller Arbitrage (2012), awkwardly pretzels a checklist of social problems into the form of a drama.

title: My Darling Supermarket Review: Cosmic Tales From the Checkout Lane
description: Somewhere in So Paulo, Brazil, theres a supermarket that looks awfully familiar. It has white fluorescent lights and endless shopping lanes. Every day, theres bread to bake and meat to grind. Its the kind of store you might find anywhere in the world. Yet, by the end of the slight but intriguingly strange documentary My Darling Supermarket, it might as well be on Mars.

title: Opponents Beware: Willow Johnson Inherited Her Fathers Left Arm
description: As the daughter of a Hall of Fame baseball player, Willow Johnson learned at a young age about the sacrifice and commitment needed to compete at the highest level of sports.

title: Tiger Woods and Another Terrible Turn of Fate
description: The sight of his demolished S.U.V., sitting forlornly on a grassy Southern California hillside, belied the image of Tiger Woods as an invincible force marching across the golf course to certain, thrilling triumph.

title: GameStop stock jumps for a second day with other meme stocks.
description: Shares of GameStop surged again on Thursday, in the second straight day of volatile trading for the video game retailer that was at the center of a trading frenzy last month.

title: The United States vs. Billie Holiday Review: Singing for Her Life
description: Every great musician is one of a kind, but the biographies of great musicians  or more precisely their biopics  end up looking pretty much alike. Childhood trauma is followed by success and its consequences, usually including addiction and love trouble. A chronicle of artistic triumph doubles as a cautionary tale, with ruin and redemption wrapped around each other like twin strands of narrative DNA. If all else fails, the soundtrack music offers occasional reminders of why we should care.

title: Has McKinsey Lost Its Luster?
description: Partners at McKinsey yesterday voted out their leader, Kevin Sneader, as the company deals with blowback over its role in the U.S. opioid crisis. It was the latest tough headline for the consulting firm, which may face growing threats to its status as a trusted adviser to companies and governments  and as a magnet for top talent.

title: Chief of Cherokee Nation Asks Jeep to Stop Using Tribes Name
description: The Cherokee Nation, for the first time, has asked Jeep to change the name of its Grand Cherokee vehicle, a move that the carmaker, preparing to release the next generation of the line, has so far resisted.

title: California Reaches Another Bleak Milestone
description: Good morning.

title: I Was Fine With Being the Breadwinner, Until 2020 Came Along
description: I was remarried two years ago to a caring and considerate man. He moved into my home with my two kids (who are now away at college). When he arrived, he subtly let me know that he didnt expect to pay any household expenses. I work part-time and have some family money, but Im still on a budget. I didnt mind paying for everything until the pandemic hit. Now, Ive lost my job and my investments have taken a hit, so my finances are tight. Ive brought up my situation several times, but my husband says things are tight for him too. (Our incomes are about the same.) I cant help feeling hurt and resentful. He knows this, but he does nothing. Any advice?

title: How Moschinos Movie Got Made
description: In an echoing soundstage off an uneven access road on the east side of Los Angeles in early February, men and women in personal protective equipment and lots of Moschino outfits were darting around monitors and directors chairs.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are a four-bedroom in Greenburgh, N.Y., and a five-bedroom in Wilton, Conn.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in the Financial district, Crown Heights and Kingsbridge.

title: Homes for Sale in Manhattan, Brooklyn and the Bronx
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: Romance Blossoms for Seniors During Quarantine
description: When 91-year-old Sam Gallo and 86-year-old Millie Hathorn got engaged in March 2020, Mr. Gallo, who is deaf from his time as crew chief on jet planes during the Korean War, wrote a letter to his three children. Only at death is love done, he wrote. While they both had been married before, he wrote, love was not done  with us.

title: Pakistan and India Renew Pledge on Cease-Fire at Troubled Border
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistan and India on Thursday reaffirmed their commitment to a cease-fire along the troubled border between the two countries after a year of bloody skirmishes, a move welcomed in both countries for lowering tensions between the nuclear-armed neighbors.

title: California Man Died After Police Knelt on Him for 5 Minutes, Family Says
description: When Maria Quinto-Collins started filming her son at her home in Antioch, Calif., on Dec. 23, he was already on the floor, unresponsive.

title: The Best States for Retirement in 2021
description: The golden years can offer great promise  moments with grandchildren, time for travel and leisure. But they can also be a source of great stress  over money, declining health and decisions about relocation.

title: MicroStrategy adds another billion dollars of Bitcoin to its balance sheet.
description: Michael Saylor, the chief executive of the business intelligence software firm MicroStrategy, believes deeply in Bitcoin and has urged other companies to shift their corporate cash into the cryptocurrency. Thats what MicroStrategy has been doing, in a bigger way than the others that have put Bitcoin on their balance sheets, the DealBook newsletter reports.

title: 50 Years Later, Gamble and Huffs Philly Sound Stirs the Soul
description: By the late 1970s, things had gotten so busy at Philadelphia International Records that the labels co-founders, Kenny Gamble and Leon Huff, had to leave town to write new songs. During one trip to Jamaica, they were settling in at the piano when a power outage hit the island.

title: 10 Classical Concerts to Stream in March
description: As the live performing arts continue to struggle through the coronavirus pandemic, here are 10 highlights from the flood of online music content coming in March. (Times listed are Eastern.)

title: WandaVision Lives Inside TV. Just Like We Do.
description: Even allowing for the pop culture invincibility of anything Marvel, Disney+s WandaVision is an odd sort of superhero show to become a phenomenon. Why, of all the comic-book premises, would America in 2021 be captivated by a story about someone escaping inside classic TV as a refuge from trauma?

title: Biden is preparing to call Saudi Arabias monarch before releasing a damning report on Jamal Khashoggis death.
description: President Biden plans to hold his first conversation with the ailing Saudi monarch, King Salman this week. And while the call will be full of diplomatic pleasantries, officials say, the real purpose is for Mr. Biden to warn that the United States will soon declassify and publish an intelligence report about the killing of the dissident and journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

title: The World in Childrens Picture Books
description: To the Editor:

title: Reply All Podcast Is Paused After Accusations of Toxic Culture
description: The popular Gimlet Media podcast Reply All has been paused and its series delving into allegations of racism at the food magazine Bon Apptit has been shelved after former Gimlet employees complained that one of its hosts and a reporter had themselves contributed to a toxic workplace culture.

title: Nirav Modi, a fugitive jeweler wanted by India, loses his extradition case.
description: Nirav Modi, a jeweler whose designs once adorned the necks of A-list celebrities, has lost an extradition case in Britains high court. Mr. Modi is wanted by the Indian government to face charges of fraud, involving transactions totaling $1.8 billion with a state-run bank.

title: Is Avalanche the Answer to a 62-Year-Old Russian Mystery Over 9 Deaths?
description: MOSCOW  What drove nine experienced hikers, some barefoot and almost naked, out of their tent and into the subzero cold and the tomblike darkness of the Russian wilderness in 1959?

title: Tracking Coronavirus Cases at U.S. Colleges and Universities
description: Coronavirus cases have continued to emerge by the tens of thousands this year at colleges, a New York Times survey has found.

title: Refugee Who Set Herself on Fire in Greece Is Charged With Arson
description: ATHENS  An Afghan woman is facing arson charges after trying to burn herself to death at a migrants camp on the Greek island of Lesbos this week, officials said on Thursday.

title: The Frick Savors the Opulence of Emptiness
description: Yesterdays robber barons lived like princes; today, theyd rather be monks.

title: My 8-Year-Old Threatened Suicide. Heres What Were Learning.
description: On a cold Friday afternoon last fall, my 8-year-old snapped. After losing a board game to his younger sister, he reached for the wooden block of knives on the counter and pulled one out. Thats it, he said through clenched teeth, Id rather be dead than play with her.

title: The T List: Five Things We Recommend This Week
description: Welcome to the T List, a newsletter from the editors of T Magazine. Each week, were sharing things were eating, wearing, listening to or coveting now. Sign up here to find us in your inbox every Wednesday. And you can always reach us at tlist@nytimes.com.

title: With The Father, a Playwright Pivots to the Screen
description: PARIS  After charming Broadway and the West End, the French playwright and director Florian Zeller may be about to repeat the trick with Hollywood.

title: Manatees May Carry Half a Million Microscopic Hitchhikers
description: Invisible worms are everywhere. Nematodes are roundworms that are mostly microscopic (although some are upsettingly large) that have adapted to a spectacular range of homes, from Antarctic soil to the inside of your gut. They are present in so many microenvironments that Nathan Cobb, a nematologist in the early 20th century, once predicted that if all the matter in the universe except the nematodes were swept away, our world would still be dimly recognizable.

title: Canadas Top Military Officer Steps Aside Amid Investigation
description: OTTAWA  Canadas top military officer temporarily stepped aside as chief of the defense staff after military police opened an investigation into unspecified accusations against him.

title: Armenia in an Uproar, as Its Prime Minister Warns of an Attempted Military Coup
description: MOSCOW  Armenia, which lost a bloody war with its neighbor Azerbaijan last fall, slipped on Thursday into a political crisis after what its prime minister called an attempted military coup.

title: Children Are Consuming Hand Sanitizer. Heres How to Keep Them Safe.
description: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer became a must-have item during the pandemic. But as sales jumped and families stocked up, poison control centers started getting more calls about little children who had accidentally ingested it.

title: An American Dream, Tarnished
Landlords Eager for Covid-Era Revamps Are Finding Hungry Investors
description: The pandemic forced owners of hotels, malls and office buildings to adjust almost overnight to a harsh reality in which millions of Americans were no longer traveling, shopping at stores or going into offices. It also depressed the vast market where such companies raise money for their commercial real estate projects.

title: Police in Malta Say Arrests Are Complete in Journalists 2017 Murder
description: More than three years after a car bomb killed Maltas best-known journalist and sent shock waves across Europe, the head of the Mediterranean island nations police force has declared that all those it believes to have been involved in the murder of Daphne Caruana Galizia have now been arrested.

title: Everything Seems So Tenuous: Variants Threaten N.Y.C.s Progress on Virus
description: Since the peak of the holiday surge in early January, New York City has seen a steep decline in the number of people testing positive for the coronavirus each day, as have the state and the nation.

title: Cherry Review: A Very Different Tangled Web for Tom Holland
description: A couple of years back, when Martin Scorsese dared to say he didnt care for superhero movies  thats not cinema, he said  two successful directors in that field, the brothers Joe and Anthony Russo, took a swipe at the older filmmaker. At the end of the day, what do we know? Joe said in an interview. Were just two guys from Cleveland, Ohio, and cinema is a New York word.

title: Lincoln Center Will Head Outside Its Closed Theaters to Perform
description: Lincoln Center is known for the grandeur of its theaters and concert halls: the stately, majestic Metropolitan Opera House, which seats 3,800; David Geffen Hall, aglow as New York Philharmonic fans file in for an evening performance; the David H. Koch Theater, home to New York City Ballet and designed specifically with dance in mind.

title: The long, painful path of net neutrality
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Teens and Parents: Are You Grappling With Mental Health Issues?
description: The adolescent experience is changing. Over the last decade, anxiety and depression  along with self-harm and suicidal thoughts  have been on the rise among young people. Wed like to hear from parents and teenagers about their experiences dealing with mental health challenges, especially before the pandemic.

title: Lady Gagas Dogs Are Stolen and Dog Walker Is Shot
description: [Update: Lady Gagas dogs are returned safely.]

title: Til Kingdom Come Review: An Unusual Religious Bond
description: Til Kingdom Come, the new documentary by Maya Zinshtein, probes the entanglements of politics and prophecy that bind two strange bedfellows: American evangelical Christians and Israeli Jews.

title: TV Taught Me About AIDS. Its a Sin Reminded Me How Far Weve Come.
description: I met Josh at the Roxy, where we made out to Gypsy Woman. We went back to my N.Y.U. dorm room. We used condoms. I dont know what happened to Josh.

title: Battling the Mob, a Black Officer Came Face to Face With Racism
description: WASHINGTON  The racist slurs hurled at Harry Dunn, a Capitol Police officer, during the Jan. 6 riot at the Capitol were cited as evidence this month in the Senates impeachment trial of former President Donald J. Trump. Until this week, Officer Dunn had remained anonymous.

title: Jennifer Granholm is confirmed as energy secretary.
description: The Senate confirmed Jennifer M. Granholm to be energy secretary on Thursday, positioning the former governor of Michigan to play a key role in President Bidens plans to confront climate change.

title: Youve Heard of Ghost Kitchens. Meet the Ghost Franchises.
description: A video from MrBeast, a 22-year-old YouTube star with 54 million subscribers, usually goes something like this: An outlandish setup  say, staging a fake robbery  results in a fans winning thousands of dollars or a new car. But in late December, MrBeast (real name: Jimmy Donaldson, an upbeat bro from North Carolina) dropped something different on his viewers.

title: Wreckage of T.W.A. Flight 800 to Be Destroyed Years After Explosion
description: Twenty-five years ago, a Boeing 747 flying from New York City to Paris exploded in midair and broke apart just off the coast of Long Island. All 230 people on board the plane, Trans World Airlines Flight 800, were killed, and the wreckage plummeted into the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Manhattan D.A. Now Has Trumps Tax Returns
description: Tax and financial records that former President Donald J. Trump fought to keep secret for nearly 18 months have been turned over to the Manhattan district attorneys office, which is investigating possible fraud by Mr. Trump and his company, an official said.

title: Officials Monitoring New Variant Detected in N.Y.C.
description: New York City officials said on Thursday that they are investigating possible risks of a new coronavirus variant spreading in the city, but that it did not appear yet to require change in public health response.

title: Twitter Shakes Off the Cobwebs With New Product Plans
description: For years, Twitter remained pretty much the same. One of its most memorable product updates was in 2017 when it doubled the number of characters that could fit into a tweet.

title: Susan Feingold Dies at 95; Helped Give New York Children a Head Start
description: In the 1960s, New York City presented a harsh landscape for its underprivileged children. Parks were dangerous, the courtyards of crumbling housing projects could be hostile zones, and preschools were expensive. But a band of parents in Manhattan resolved to take matters into their own hands, led by a strong-willed woman named Susan Feingold, who had narrowly escaped the Holocaust as a girl.

title: Julien Baker Explores the Art of Doubt on Little Oblivions
description: In 2015, when the young Tennessee singer and songwriter Julien Baker released her quietly lacerating debut album, Sprained Ankle, she arrived with an origin story that flashed the false promise of condensing her in just three loaded words: Christian, queer, sober.

title: 12 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: It can be misleading to talk about the church  the Black church, the evangelical church, whatever  as a monolithic institution, since it blurs the real differences that exist among denominations or congregations, even among the different members of any given parish. The church is an institution in the same way as the press or the judiciary, which is to say: It is one, but its messy.

title: The Outsized Influence of Teen T. Rex and Other Young Dinosaurs
description: Adolescence is a time of great change for most of us. But it was particularly volatile for young T. rexes. Before they became fearsome, bone-crushing adults, they had to pass through a number of stages  two-foot hatchling, gangly preteen, bulky young adult. At each phase, they hunted different prey and filled different niches.

title: The Birth of Rent, Its Creators Death and the 25 Years Since
description: Whats 525,600 times 25?

title: Rand Paul Lashes Out at Rachel Levine About Genital Mutilation
description: Dr. Rachel Levine, President Bidens assistant secretary of health nominee, stands to be the first openly transgender federal official confirmed by the Senate. At a hearing on Thursday, Senator Rand Paul asked Dr. Levine about her stance on genital mutilation and minors.

title: Hey, Hun!
description: Where most observers saw devastation in the 5 million American women who lost their jobs during the pandemic, and the 2.1 million who left the workforce entirely, multilevel marketing companies saw potential recruits.

title: At a Senate hearing and on the House floor, emotional debates erupt over transgender rights.
description: A culture war over transgender rights erupted on Capitol Hill on Thursday, as a Republican senator attacked President Bidens nominee to a top health post, and two members of the House  one the mother of a transgender daughter  sparred over legislation that would extend civil rights protections to L.G.B.T.Q. people.

title: The White House continues to fight for Tandens confirmation, a battle it didnt expect to wage.
description: On Wednesday night, Ron Klain, the White House chief of staff, went on television to proclaim that the Biden administration was still fighting our guts out to get Neera Tanden confirmed as the head of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Million-Dollar Slice
description: Chris Barrett has made bank on the gray market selling pizza laced with THC. Can the Pizza Pusha survive pot legalization?

title: Navigating My Sons A.D.H.D. Made Me Realize I Had It, Too
description: I heard my 7-year-old sons cries of frustration loud and clear despite the closed door between us. Seconds earlier, Id left him stationed at a desk in my bedroom, hoping hed complete at least a portion of his virtual school assignments without me at his side while I left to wash the dishes.

title: Helping Migrant Children
description: To the Editor:

title: After Alarmism
description: The war on climate denial has been won. And thats not the only good news.

title: What Students Are Saying About Vaccine Trials, Sports Without Spectators and a Chaotic Year
description: Welcome to another roundup of student comments on our writing prompts. This week we asked teenagers if they would volunteer for a Covid-19 vaccine trial, if they are missing live sports and how they have dealt with a chaotic year.

title: Human Trafficking Charges and Coachs Death Reopen Gymnastics Deep Wounds
description: The sexual abuse crisis that has shaken American gymnastics deepened on Thursday when a coach of the 2012 womens Olympic team was charged with human trafficking and sexually assaulting a teenage girl, before killing himself a short time later.

title: How We Can Better Predict Weather Catastrophes
description: We are playing Russian roulette with extreme climate events.

title: What Madison Cawthorn Saw at the Insurrection
description: The youngest member of Congress is invigorated by the mob he helped incite.

title: The minimum wage fight intensifies as lawmakers wait on a critical decision by the Senate parliamentarian.
description: The battle over the federal minimum wage  long a deferred dream for Democrats  moved to the forefront on Thursday as lawmakers waited to see if inclusion of a $15-per-hour wage in President Bidens $1.9 trillion pandemic bill passes parliamentary muster.

title: Florence Birdwell, Singing Teacher to Broadway Stars, Dies at 96
description: Florence Birdwell, an inspiring voice teacher whose many students included the Tony Award-winning musical stars Kelli OHara and Kristin Chenoweth, died on Feb. 15 in Yukon, Okla. She was 96.

title: Whats Going On in This Graph? | March 3, 2021
When Podcast Hosts Speak, What Do We Hear?
description: Podcast voice has been parodied, co-opted and commodified. With lip flutters and giddyap words, our reporter learned how to talk the talk.

title: Canadians Try to Solve the Enigma of Hard Butter
description: MONTREAL  As Canadians nurse their pandemic blues by baking bread and pies with zeal, a mystery has engulfed the nation: Why is the countrys butter so hard and difficult to spread?

title: Sarah McBrides Neighborhood
description: The new Delaware state senator is making history in her hometown.

title: New Covid-19 Infections Have Fallen to Half in Europe, W.H.O. Says
description: Heightened restrictions on social interaction have caused the rates of Covid-19 cases to fall in Europe. But the World Health Organization cautioned that new cases were still 10 times as high as they were last May.

title: Prom King
description: With a big Netflix deal and the power to green-light almost anything, Ryan Murphy has become the ultimate insider. And his work is suffering.

title: Clubhouse Is Dangerously Close to Becoming Our New Internet Wasteland
description: Whats true of any social-media endeavor remains the same on this app: Give people the space to talk, and they will say too much.

title: Mitch McConnell Doesnt Get to Define Bipartisan
description: Among the more farcical developments of the early Biden presidency has been congressional Republicans newfound passion for bipartisanship.

title: Germans Clamor for Covid Vaccines, but Shun AstraZenecas Offering
description: BERLIN  At the start of the year, many Germans were complaining about a shortage of coronavirus vaccines that could free them from onerous lockdowns and limited social lives. Just weeks later, many are now upset that theyre not getting the vaccine they want.

title: Patrick Filien, Peripatetic Basketball Coach, Dies at 51
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: We Want to Hear From Teen Parents
description: The Times is looking for stories of teen parents juggling caring for their own children during the pandemic while also dealing with the unique challenges of remote schooling.

title: Living With Karens
description: A white woman calls the police on her Black neighbors. Six months later, they still share a property line.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Facebook said it had banned Myanmars military from its platforms, leaving little question that the company was openly siding with the countrys pro-democracy movement against the figures who abruptly seized power on Feb. 1, ousting the civilian leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi.

title: Neera Tanden: First Cabinet-Level Casualty of the Twitter Age?
description: WASHINGTON  Neera Tanden, you might have heard, has a Twitter problem.

title: Best of the Archives: Whitney Houston
description: Were preparing to drop a whole new season this spring. In the meantime, we want to make sure youve had a chance to hear some of our all-time favorite episodes. Like this one, about Whitney Houston.

title: How to Clean 5 Surprisingly Gross Things
description: You might be shocked by how dirty some of your household items can get. Here's what to do about them.

title: Are Disposables the Future of Photo Sharing?
description: Dispo, a new photo-sharing app that mimics the experience of using a disposable camera, is taking off. People are clamoring for invites to test the beta version. Early adopters are praising its social features. And investors are betting big on its future.

title: Who Did J.K. Rowling Become?
description: Deciphering the most beloved, most reviled childrens-book author in history.

title: House Passes Sweeping Gay and Transgender Equality Legislation
description: WASHINGTON  A divided House on Thursday narrowly passed a bill that would extend civil rights protections to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation or gender identity, but the measure faced an uphill battle to enactment, with Republicans almost uniformly opposed.

title: Give Biden a Chance? On Covid Aid, Some Trump Voters Just Might
description: In Washington, Republicans stand united in opposition to President Bidens first major legislative proposal, a $1.9 trillion economic rescue plan that they have labeled a bloated, budget-busting blue state bailout.

title: Rajie Cook, Who Helped Make Sense of Public Spaces, Dies at 90
description: Rajie Cook often joked that museumgoers were more likely to encounter his artwork in their travels than a portrait by Matisse or a landscape by van Gogh. They saw it whenever they took an elevator to an upper gallery or stopped in the restroom.

title: Mr. Potato Head Brand Goes Gender Neutral (Sort Of)
description: Hasbro is giving its venerable Mr. Potato Head toy a more gender-inclusive identity by dropping the Mr. from its brand name and packaging.

title: California Lost 175,000 Creative Economy Jobs, Study Finds
description: Arts advocates and elected officials in California called on Thursday for additional government spending to avert what one organization leader called a pending cultural depression brought on by the pandemic.

title: Bidens Pick for Trade Representative Promises Break With Past Policy
description: WASHINGTON  Katherine Tai, President Bidens pick for United States trade representative, promised lawmakers during her confirmation hearing on Thursday that she would work with Congress to help reinvigorate the economy and aggressively enforce American trade rules against China, Mexico and other trading partners.

title: The 65-Year-Old Helping to Un-Deplatform Parler
description: Jeffrey Wernick is not your typical tech investor.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: A new variant of the coronavirus has been identified in New York City, and it contains an alarming mutation that may make it less susceptible to vaccines.

title: Afghan Government Backs Repatriation of Guantnamo Detainee
description: WASHINGTON  The government of Afghanistan has filed a petition in federal court supporting the return of a citizen who has been held for a third of his life at Guantnamo Bay and now argues that, based on a series of peace agreements in his fractious country, his war is over.

title: Loretta Whitfield, Whose Black Doll Was Ahead of Its Time, Dies at 79
description: In the early 1980s, Melvin Whitfield was working for a health nonprofit in West Africa when he came to a realization: Few of the children he encountered had dolls, and the dolls he did see were modeled after white European faces and bodies.

title: Biden Announces 50 Million Vaccinations Since Taking Office
description: President Biden said on Thursday that 50 million coronavirus vaccines have been administered since Jan. 20, a halfway point toward his goal of administering 100 million in his first 100 days in office.

title: Chlo Zhaos America
description: The creator of quiet indie dramas is now the most-sought-after director in Hollywood.

title: After 10 Months at Sea, a Giant Carrier Returns to a Changed Nation
description: ABOARD U.S.S. NIMITZ, off California  When this aircraft carrier and its city-size crew departed Naval Base Kitsap in Bremerton, Wash., on April 27, George Floyd was still alive.

title: 13 Y.A. Books to Add to Your Reading List This Spring
description: Yolk, by Mary H.K. Choi (Simon & Schuster Books for Young Readers, March 2)

title: Glitzy, Tragic and Selfish: Female Con Artists Waltz by Societys Rules
description: The author Tori Telfer on female con artists

title: Militia Groups Want to Blow Up the Capitol, a Police Chief Testifies
description: WASHINGTON  The acting chief of the Capitol Police warned lawmakers on Thursday that extremist groups that carried out the Jan. 6 riot want to blow up the Capitol and kill lawmakers around President Bidens first formal address to Congress, calling for security measures deployed after the deadly attack to remain for several more weeks.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: Every Monday and Friday, Margaret offers hyper-specific viewing recommendations in our Watching newsletter. Read her latest picks below, and sign up for the Watching newsletter here.

title: Pelosi Expects $15 Minimum Wage Will Be Included in Pandemic Bill
description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said that Democrats have a very strong argument for including a $15-per-hour minimum wage in President Bidens $1.9 trillion pandemic response bill.

title: Making the Cut
description: Theres always someone whose job it is to decide if you measure up.

title: House Approves Sweeping L.G.B.T.Q. Equality Legislation
description: The House narrowly passed the Equality Act on Thursday, a bill that would prohibit discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Lights, Camera, Christmas!
description: This holiday season, we bring you a show filled with stories of people going to great lengths to throw a special Christmas for their families.

title: The Coronavirus Is Threatening a Comeback. Heres How to Stop It.
description: Across the United States, and the world, the coronavirus seems to be loosening its stranglehold. The deadly curve of cases, hospitalizations and deaths has yo-yoed before, but never has it plunged so steeply and so fast.

title: Manchin, Trump Taxes, John Geddert: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: This Senator Has Got the Math Wrong About a $15 Minimum Wage
description: Senator John Thune, Republican of South Dakota, said Wednesday that he opposed raising the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour, explaining that he earned just $6 an hour as a teenager working over summer vacations as a restaurant cook.

title: Confirmation in Doubt for Neera Tanden, Bidens Budget Director Pick
description: WASHINGTON  President Bidens nominee to head the Office of Management and Budget continued to face Senate opposition on Thursday, narrowing her chances of confirmation and sending White House officials on a frantic search for at least one Republican vote to salvage her nomination.

title: Bill Wright, Who Broke a Color Barrier in Golf, Dies at 84
description: Bill Wright, the first Black competitor to win a United States Golf Association event in an era when African-Americans were not welcome either in segregated country clubs or in the top amateur and professional ranks, died on Feb. 19 at his home in Los Angeles. He was 84.

title: CPAC Starts Tomorrow and Trump Is Still Center of the Republican Universe
description: Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: The Paradox of Pandemic Partisanship
description: President Bidens Covid-19 relief proposal remains incredibly popular; if anything, its getting more popular as it barrels through Congress. Multiple polls show that something like 70 percent of Americans approve of the $1.9 trillion plan. Its almost twice as popular as the Republican tax cut of 2017; its more popular than the Obama stimulus of 2009; its hard to believe now, but the Biden plan is more popular than Medicare was in the months before it passed in 1965.

title: How to Get Really Rich!
description: I know money cant buy you love, but wouldnt it be nice to have enough money to buy whatever else you want?

title: Lawmakers Clash Over Call for Special Panel to Investigate Capitol Assault
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans were leery of the prospect of an independent commission to investigate an assault that had shaken the nation and exposed dangerous threats, fearful that Democrats would use it to unfairly cast blame and a political shadow on them.

title: On the Ground in Texas, 10 Days Later
description: The temperatures are back to normal, but daily life is still a struggle for Texans affected by last weeks storms.

title: Film Club: The Paradise Next Door
description: Note to Teachers: As with all our films, please preview to make sure the film is appropriate for your students.

title: Top Senate Official Disqualifies Minimum Wage From Stimulus Plan
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats suffered a major setback on Thursday in their bid to push through a $15-an-hour minimum wage as part of President Bidens $1.9 trillion stimulus package, after the Senates top rule-enforcer said that the increase could not be included in the bill.

title: The Impact and Influence of Tiger Woods: Here. There. Everywhere.
description: BRADENTON, Fla.  Tiger Woods was never expected to play in the first round of the PGA Tour event held Thursday in Central Florida. It did not matter. His presence, his influence, the impact of his life and career was evident throughout the grounds.

title: D.C.s Mayor Mourned Covids Unequal Toll. Her Sister Is the Latest Victim.
description: In the long season of the pandemic, Washington, D.C., managed to avoid some of the grimmest numbers. Relative to its population, there have been fewer known cases in the city than in most states, and far fewer deaths than in New Orleans or New York City.

title: U.S. Airstrikes in Syria Target Iran-Backed Militias That Rocketed American Troops in Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  The United States on Thursday carried out airstrikes in eastern Syria against buildings belonging to what the Pentagon said were Iran-backed militias responsible for recent attacks against American and allied personnel in Iraq.

title: Granholm Sworn In as Energy Secretary
description: Jennifer M. Granholm on Thursday became the second woman to lead the Department of Energy, an agency with a key role in creating a greener economy under the Biden administration.

title: Residents of a Texas Border City Long Felt Overlooked. The Storm Made It Worse.
description: DEL RIO, Texas  Surrounded by ranch land, towering mesquite trees and acres of thorny brush, the border city of Del Rio can feel like the definition of rural Texas. Residents said they have long felt alienated from the states power centers and bewildered by the shifting approaches to immigration by their elected leaders in Washington.

title: Biden Speaks With Saudi King; Unclear if Khashoggi Killing Was Discussed
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden held his first call with King Salman of Saudi Arabia on Thursday, but the official White House description of it made no mention of the imminent release of an American intelligence report that implicates the kings son, and heir apparent, in the killing of the dissident journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

title: The Masks of Mexico
description: SAN MIGUEL DE ALLENDE, Mexico  We Mexicans live behind masks of our own creation, even if in these portraits they are more a symbolic gesture of futility than protection.

title: Victim Blaming and Sex Education in the Boys Club of Australian Politics
description: When Brittany Higgins first alleged earlier this month that she had been raped in a Parliament building, the Australian governments initial response was silence.

title: At Least Eight Killed in Haiti Prison Break
description: CROIX-DES-BOUQUETS, Haiti  At least seven prisoners and a police officer were killed and another person injured on Thursday after several inmates, including one of Haitis most powerful gang leaders, escaped from a prison in Port-au-Prince, the capital, the authorities  said.

title: Man Killed 3 After Early Release, Officials Say
description: An Oklahoma man who was released early from prison broke into a womans home this month, cut out her heart, cooked it and tried to feed it to his relatives  and then killed two of them, the authorities said this week.

title: Billie Eilish: The Worlds a Little Blurry Review: Fame and Family
description: Billie Eilish, the ultramodern pop star whos both colorfully gothic and establishment-friendly, is a fascinating subject: vividly creative, offhandedly vulnerable, barely visibly self-conscious. And also, a teenager. Billie Eilish: The Worlds a Little Blurry, the new documentary about her rise, finds her shaping global aesthetics while cocooned in a close-knit family, and treats both circumstances with equal casualness. In this film, all of Eilishs interactions are human-scale, or smaller.

title: Governors relax restrictions as infection numbers fall.
description: With the coronavirus slowly receding, governors around the United States are beginning to relax pandemic restrictions.

title: Creators Leeway
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Administrivial alert from Deb: Some readers have asked why other people like Caitlin Lovinger and Isaac Aronow have been writing the daily column over the past week. There are multiple answers to that excellent question. The first is that my husband was recently diagnosed with Covid-19, and I am taking care of him at home. The second is that Mr. Aronow is the new associate editor for Wordplay and he is learning to write columns as part of his training. I hope you will welcome him. The third reason is that my job encompasses much more than the daily column, and as much as I love writing it, I cannot always do both on deadline. Also, occasionally, they let me take a vacation day. So no, I am not on my way out, as one reader helpfully suggested. You cant get rid of me that easily.

title: Manslaughter Charge for Officer Accused of Shooting Man in the Back
description: An Oklahoma City police sergeant who shot a man three times in the back as he ran away last December was charged on Thursday with manslaughter.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Two weeks after 1.45 million doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine arrived in Germany, only 270,986 have been administered, public health officials said, even as people around the world clamor for inoculations and many countries have seen severe shortages.

title: F.C.C. Approves a $50 Monthly High-Speed Internet Subsidy
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Communications Commission on Thursday approved an emergency subsidy for low-income households to get high-speed internet, an effort to bridge the digital divide that has cut off many Americans from online communication during the pandemic.

title: Quotation of the Day: Black Officer Felt Mobs Fury, and Sting of Racism
description: A war is made up of 100 battles. We were all in the war, but we all had different battles. A lot of us Black officers fought a different battle than everybody else fought.

title: Corrections: Feb. 26, 2021
description: An article on Monday about revised rates for flood coverage misstated rules governing rates for home insurance policies. Federal Emergency Management Agency rules allow buyers for whom a property is a primary residence to assume the previous owners policy. It is not always the case that new owners of homes must pay full rates for insurance immediately.

title: I Met My Husband on the Maternity Ward
description: My birth story, which is also my love story, began nearly 40 years ago in the mountain town of Spalding, Jamaica. It has been told to me time and again by the two women who were there that April day  my mother, Lorna, and a stranger, Lurline, who was giving birth in the same open ward.

title: China Persecutes Those Who Question Heroes. A Sleuth Keeps Track.
description: In China, dont question the heroes.

title: 5 Picture Books About the Wonders of Science
description: FOSSILS FROM LOST WORLDSWritten by Damien LaverduntIllustrated by Hlne RajcakTranslated by Daniel Hahn

title: Seth Meyers Is Excited to See Trumps Tax Returns
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word + Quiz: punctilious
Street Scavenging
In a Changing Military, the Army Eases Its Rules for Womens Hair
description: As an Army National Guard officer who has deployed all over the world, Capt. Jawana McFadden always felt the Armys strict rules toward womens hair needlessly compromised not only who she was as a person, but how she performed as a soldier.

title: Michael Somare, Papua New Guineas Father of the Nation, Dies at 84
description: Michael Somare, Papua New Guineas first prime minister, who played a major role in leading the country to independence from Australia, died on Friday in Port Moresby, the capital. He was 84.

title: Hundreds of Nigerian Students Kidnapped, Police Say
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  Gunmen abducted 317 girls from a boarding school in northern Nigeria on Friday, the police said, the latest in a series of mass kidnappings of students in the northern part of the country.

title: Lesson of the Day: The Other Serena
description: Featured Article: The Other Serena by Matthew Futterman and Alana Holmberg

title: An Obituary Series With a Life of Its Own
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: How a Gen-Z Disney Star Wrote a Runaway Hit
description: See how the singer-songwriter and actress wrote her chart-topping first single  after a good cry and with TikTok in mind.

title: Aliens, Book Organizing Tricks and Other Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New in Paperback: Real Life and A Game of Birds and Wolves
description: REAL LIFE, by Brandon Taylor. (Riverhead, 336 pp., $16.) Taylors Booker Prize-shortlisted debut follows a Southern Black gay grad student who is mining hope for some better or different life in the haunted halls of a white academic space, Jeremy O. Harris wrote in his review. Emotionally, he said, Taylor subjugates us with the deft hand of a dom.

title: Weekly Health Quiz: Diet, Weight and Covid
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: Murder, Mayhem and Menace: New Crime Fiction
description: Ah, sinkholes. So random, so terrifying, they turn neighborhoods into oozing wounds  especially when grievances fester angrily underneath the surface. Sarah Langan plumbs these literal and metaphorical depths as they rip apart a once-bucolic suburb in her disturbing and mordantly funny new novel, GOOD NEIGHBORS (Atria, 296 pp., $27), a departure and an extension of her early horror fiction.

title: His Debut Novel Won the Pulitzer. Now It Has an Action-Packed Sequel.
description: THE COMMITTEDBy Viet Thanh Nguyen

title: The New York Times News Quiz, Feb. 26, 2021
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: An Unexpected Move From Emergency Roommates to Soul Mates
description: Jiordan Castle was looking for a roommate. Instead, she found love.

title: The Texas Crisis Could Become Everyones Crisis
description: Last week, freezing temperatures overwhelmed the Texas power grid, setting off rolling blackouts that left millions without power during an intense winter storm. But this story is a lot bigger than Texas: Our world is built around a model of the climate from the 19th and 20th centuries. Global warming is going to crack that model apart, and with it, much of the physical and political infrastructure civilization relies on.

title: Operation Car Wash Was No Magic Bullet
description: Brazil is experiencing several crises at the same time  the catastrophic health situation, the fragile economy and extreme political polarization. We can now add corruption of the judicial system to the list. It didnt have to be like this. Brazilians had high hopes seven years ago, when a young magistrate named Sergio Moro launched an anti-corruption operation called Lava Jato, or Operation Car Wash.

title: Ice and Snow Would Not Stop Their Wedding in Texas
description: Jerimy LBene Craft and Courtney Marie Broussard never imagined that the coronavirus would be the least of their worries when it came to their Feb. 14, 2021 wedding. Little did they know that a winter storm was about to put a deep freeze on their Valentines Day wedding.

title: Winning Her Over With Easy Conversation and Home-Cooked Meals
description: In 2014, shortly after graduating from the University of Pennsylvania, Shannon Leon moved to Washington and rented a room in an all-female house via Craigslist. Her new roommates sometimes got together with a group of guys that included John Keiran, who admired Ms. Leon from afar for months.

title: How an Artisanal Doughnut Maker Spends Her Sundays
description: When Kimberly Camara was laid off from her job last March as a research and development cook in the hospitality industry, she decided to move in temporarily with her parents in Bayside, Queens. There, she found comfort in baking, developing her own style of doughnut made with leftover brioche dough.

title: Should We End the Practice of Tipping?
description: Do you ever tip people for their service? For instance, after riding in a taxi, receiving a food delivery or eating at a restaurant? Why or why not? And if yes, how much money do you generally pay? A dollar? Ten percent? Twenty percent? More?

title: The Loneliest Room, for My Sister in a Nursing Home
description: When I saw my sister Peggy in her nursing home last June, she was sitting up in bed, leaning forward slightly and staring into the corner of her room. She was 67, and did not know who I was. It had been five months since my last trip to see her. That time, she was in a hospital psychiatric unit being re-evaluated for treatment for both bipolar disorder and Alzheimers disease. It had taken her a moment to recognize me then, but once she did she hugged me and kept up a stream of chatter as we walked laps around the floor.

title: He Was a Bad Boy Harpsichordist, and the Best of His Age
description: Nicolas Bomsel was a radio producer in Paris when he had lunch with Scott Ross early in 1984.

title: A Kiss Before the Barristers Ball and Now Theyve Made it Legal
description: Alexandra Newman White and Joel Benzion Kuzniecky met in September 2014 on their first day at Fordham Law school in New York. They were randomly assigned seats next to each other in a property law class. They were both in Section 5.

title: Which Vaccine Should You Get?
description: This Op-Ed has been updated to reflect news developments.

title: Is New York Finally Ready to Tax the Rich?
description: This September it will be 10 years since thousands of people descended on Zuccotti Park, in Lower Manhattan, to protest economic inequity  one result of a financial industry left to operate like a fraternity in an unmanned bar.

title: The Deep South Has a Rich History of Resistance, as Amazon Is Learning
description: The Deep South is not generally known for its labor agitation, which is why it might come as a surprise for some to learn that it is in Alabama where workers have mounted one of the largest and most aggressive efforts to unionize Amazon in recent memory.

title: A Starbucks Run Leads to a Walk to the Altar
description: Jessy Warner-Cohen had been dating Aryeh Levin for only three months when she texted him from Mile 19 of the 2019 New York Marathon, near the Willis Avenue Bridge, to say she had reached her limit and wasnt sure she could take another step. His response, she said, was immediate and emphatic. He sent me a slew of texts: you have to, youve got this, you trained for this.

title: Drivers License Is a Runaway Hit. See How Olivia Rodrigo Made Her No. 1 Song.
description: For six straight weeks starting in January, the top spot on the Billboard Hot 100 has been held by just one song: Drivers License, the first solo single by a teenager who either came out of nowhere or was already a star, depending on whom you ask.

title: A Special Unit to Prosecute Police Killings Has No Convictions
description: More than five years ago, Andrew M. Cuomo, the governor of New York, signed an executive order to address a persistent concern: Police officers were rarely held accountable for killing unarmed people. Often, those who died were Black.

title: Trump to Dominate CPAC as Activists Assess Potential 2024 Candidates
description: After a month of operating uncharacteristically behind the scenes from Mar-a-Lago, Donald J. Trump will make the debut appearance of his post-presidency at the Conservative Political Action Conference on Sunday, and much as in the incipient 2024 presidential primary race, he is expected to overshadow the other Republican politicians who precede him.

title: Where Have All the Houses Gone?
description: Much of the housing market has gone missing. On suburban streets and in many urban neighborhoods, across large and midsize metro areas, many homes that would have typically come up for sale over the past year never did. Even in cities with a pandemic glut of empty apartments and falling rents, it has become incredibly hard to buy a home.

title: Simone Rocha on Being Part of Fashion Week in a Pandemic
description: The Irish fashion designer Simone Rocha has been busy celebrating 10 years in business. This week she presented her fall 2021 collection as part of London Fashion Week. And on March 12, a long-awaited collaboration with H&M will hit stores. As part of a special fashion week series, she spoke to The New York Times from her studio in East London.

title: A Sacred Place Undone by Trump Must Be Saved by Biden
description: The American West embraces more than its share of spectacular landscapes. But theres nothing else quite like the vast swath of canyons, mesas, sandstone spires and arches that stretches some 80 miles from north to south in the southeast corner of Utah, ranging in altitude from sagebrush flats to pinyon-and-juniper forests and old growth stands of ponderosa pine and Douglas fir.

title: What Kind of Plane Am I Flying On?
description: Passengers on board a United Airlines flight from Denver to Honolulu had several moments of terror on Feb. 20 when their plane, a Boeing 777-200, experienced a right-engine failure shortly after takeoff, causing a massive bang and sending debris raining down over a quiet Denver suburb. Passengers captured video, much of it shared on social media, of the planes Pratt & Whitney engine, its cover ripped off, its turbine oscillating and in flames. The plane, which had 231 passengers and 10 crew members on board, returned to Denver and landed safely.

title: Finally, Some Fashion Films Worth Watching
description: Jennifer Lopez crooning Blondies Call Me while writhing in a phone booth in a trench and logo tee. Michael B. Jordan strutting Shaft-like in the streets of New York in a sheepskin jacket and fine gauge turtleneck  the sexiest man alive, looking even finer in those beautiful threads, according to a voice-over. Keneti James Apa, a.k.a., KJ Apa of Riverdale, playing a news anchor straight from Weekend Update and revealing an uptick in mysterious animals, as Kaia Gerber opens a handbag to discover a nest of duck eggs.

title: A Teenager Was Bullied. His Ancestors Saved Him.
description: In March 2008, Dennis Richmond Jr. watched Roots with his father, and it changed his life. It was a Sunday, the Richmonds day for leafing through family photographs in their apartment in Yonkers, N.Y., looking at relatives going back about a century. Roots, Alex Haleys semifictional account of his familys journey from West Africa, posed a challenge: How far back could young Dennis trace his own ancestors?

title: Two Filmmakers Write Their Own Love Story
description: If Sasha Kelly Jackson and Stephen Small-Warner II are spotted passing a treasured old notebook back and forth in their old age, it wont be because a Nicholas Sparks novel inspired them. Their small spiral pad, pawned off by a stranger at an airport, has its own plot twists.

title: Hunting for a Giant Black Hole, Astronomers Found a Nest of Darkness
description: Two astronomers recently went looking for a monster black hole. They sifted reams of data from the most powerful telescopes on and above Earth for any sign of an invisible object hundreds of times the mass of the sun in a distant cloud of stars known as NGC 6397.

title: The Secret Life of a Coronavirus
description: Last spring, coyotes strolled down the streets of San Francisco in broad daylight. Pods of rarely seen pink dolphins cavorted in the waters around Hong Kong. In Tel Aviv, jackals wandered a city park, a herd of mountain goats took over a town in Wales, and porcupines ambled through Romes ancient ruins. As the canals in Venice turned strangely clear, cormorants started diving for fish, and Canada geese escorted their goslings down the middle of Las Vegas Boulevard, passing empty shops displaying Montblanc pens and Fendi handbags.

title: Why Are Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos So Interested in Space?
description: Why do the worlds two richest men want to get off the planet so badly?

title: Sourdough on Shabbat? Inside the Citys Kosher Food Revolution
description: Tuna tartare is the new gefilte fish.

title: A Critic of Technology Turns Her Gaze Inward
description: In the spring of 1977, when Sherry Turkle was a young professor at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Steve Jobs came to visit. While he toured the campus and met with her colleagues, Turkle was cleaning her apartment and worrying over the menu for the dinner she had agreed to host.

title: Attacks on Asian-Americans in New York Stoke Fear, Anxiety and Anger
description: Maggie Cheng could stand to watch the video only once.

title: Who Is Arora Akanksha, the 34-Year-Old Running for U.N. Secretary General?
description: UNITED NATIONS  Never mind that Arora Akanksha has worked at the United Nations for only about four years, as an auditor recruited from an accounting firm. Put aside that at age 34, she has no diplomatic experience.

title: Bosses Shouldnt Demand That You Be Vaccinated
description: Since banishing the coronavirus from workplaces will be a key to opening the economy  and keeping it open  some companies are considering whether to require their workers to be vaccinated. The chief executive of United Airlines has said he favors making the shots mandatory, and several cruise lines will ask their crews to be vaccinated before returning to work. The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission has said it is legal for companies to require their employees to get coronavirus vaccines. But these types of mandates are best imposed by governments, not by private companies.

title: Why Common Colds Might Spike When Kids Return to School
